title: Senior Backend Developer
company_industry: Staffing and Recruiting and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
*Are you an experienced developer eager to shape cutting-edge solutions in high-performance computing? Join our client in developing their Slurm front-end for simulation clusters (HPC) and be part of a team that pushes the boundaries of technology.* 




  





**About the position** 




 We are looking for a skilled Backend Developer to join our client’s team and contribute to the development of the Slurm front-end solution for simulation clusters (HPC). The client company is a world-leading supplier of transport solutions and together with partners and customers, they are driving the transition to a sustainable transport system. The position is located at our client’s large headquarters in Södertälje. You will work in a hybrid setup, with two days per week at the office.
 



  





**Your characteristics** 




 In this role, we are looking for a developer with strong Python expertise and a solid understanding of DevOps practices, including CI/CD, automated testing, and observability. You thrive in large and complex environments, enjoy collaborating across teams, and have the ability to mentor and guide others. A passion for writing clean, efficient code is at the core of who you are. Experience with HPC, Slurm, or license management is highly valued, but above all, we are seeking someone with the drive to continuously improve both solutions and ways of working.
 



 Does this sound exciting? We look forward to reading your application!
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or Physics
* Minimum 8 years of relevant professional experience
* Strong Python development skills
* Strong DevOps background with CI/CD, automated testing, and monitoring/observability
* Previous experience from large companies and teams
* Ability to mentor colleagues and help improve ways of working



  





**Meriting** 



* Working with HPC and Slurm, Licens management
* Working with Linux and Slurm applications



  





**Contract type and hours** 




 Full-time consulting assignment until 2026-12-23. Start 2025-10-23.
 



  





  





**Application** 




 Please apply through our website at perido.se/lediga-jobb/. Simply click the “Apply” button in the job advertisement, fill in your details, and upload your CV. We recommend submitting your application as soon as possible, as the selection process is ongoing. Please note that some details about the assignment and/or client company may have been deliberately disclosed in the advertisement. If your profile matches what the client is looking for and you are contacted by a recruiter, you will receive all the information you need.
 



 You can find answers to most questions or concerns at
 
 perido.se/vanliga-fragor/
 
 . If you still haven’t found the answer you are looking for, you are most welcome to contact us at fraga@perido.se and one of our Recruitment Communicators will answer you. Always enter the reference number
 **35469** 
 in the subject line. Please note that we only accept applications through our website and that we are unable to provide updates on your status in the process or disclose the client company if it has been omitted from the advertisement.
 



  





**About Perido** 




 Why is our company named Perido? The name comes from the Latin word
 *Peridoneus* 
 , which means ‘well-matched’. Perido is a consulting and recruitment company specializing in the white-collar sector, dedicated to helping you take the next step in your career. Our vision is to ensure that everyone thrives and feels engaged at work. We have grown steadily since our founding in 2003 and now have over 1,500 employees across the country, including around fifty internal staff at our headquarters in Stockholm and Gothenburg. As a Perido consultant, you’ll play a key role in our organization, growing alongside us while strengthening our clients’ businesses with your skills. Please visit our website www.perido.se for more information.

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
**Tech with a Human Touch** 




 ANIMARUM söker en senior .NET-utvecklare som vill jobba som expertkonsult. Här arbetar vi med målmedveten innovation och ser teknik som något som stärker både individer och organisationer, inte bara som ett verktyg.
 



  
 



**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som senior .NET utvecklare kommer du att: 
 



  




* Designa och utveckla robusta och skalbara lösningar i .NET-plattformen med fokus på kvalitet, säkerhet och hög prestanda.



  




* Arbeta med moderna ramverk och tekniker som ASP.NET Core, C#, Entity Framework och Azure.



  




* Arbeta nära kunder och interna tvärfunktionella team, förstå behov och mål, och ta fram lösningar som skapar verkligt värde.



  
 


* Kunna vara med och driva hela leveranskedjan — från första möte och strategi till implementation, driftsättning och testning.



  




* Ansvara för teknisk kvalitet, systemarkitektur och pålitlighet i lösningar som kontinuerligt förbättras och utvecklas.



  




* Dela kunskap, coacha kollegor och bidra till att höja teamets utvecklingspraxis genom feedback, mentorskap och gemensamt lärande. Transparens, öppen kommunikation och samarbete är kärnan i vår arbetsmetod.



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, varav flera år med .NET och C#.



  




* Djup förståelse för molntjänster (AWS, Azure och/eller GCP) samt erfarenhet av Infrastructure-as-Code (ex. ARM Templates, Bicep eller Terraform)



  




* Kunskap inom prestanda, säkerhet och tillförlitlighet.



  




* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska.



  
 


* Förmåga att ta ansvar för helheten i tekniska leveranser.



  




* En vilja att bidra till ett kreativt och inkluderande arbetsklimat.



  




* Erfarenhet och/eller en öppenhet för att jobba Fullstack när det behövs.



  





  
 



 Varför ANIMARUM 
 



 På ANIMARUM handlar det inte bara om jobbet – det handlar om att vara en del av ett team där alla stöttar varandra. Vi tror på ett människocentrerat förhållningssätt. 
 



  





 Vi är ett team som verkligen bryr oss om varandra och strävar efter att skapa en arbetsplats där alla kan växa och lyckas. 
 



  
 



 Möjligheter att växa 
 



  
 



 Balans mellan arbete och fritid 
 



 Vi förstår att livet inte bara handlar om arbete. Vi stöttar dig i att hitta den perfekta balansen mellan karriär och privatliv. 
 



  
 



 Förmåner som gör livet enklare 
 



 På ANIMARUM vill vi att våra medarbetare ska blomstra – inte bara på jobbet, utan i livet. Därför erbjuder vi en rad förmåner som gör livet lite enklare: 
 



  
 



 Friskvårdsbidrag 
 



 Stärk ditt välmående med vårt friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 SEK varje år. Oavsett om det gäller gymkort, massage eller något annat som får dig att må bra – det är ditt att använda! 
 



  
 



 Företagsbil eller cykel 
 



 Res med stil med möjlighet till företagsbil eller företagscykel – perfekt för din dagliga pendling eller helgäventyr. 
 



  
 



 Bruttolöneavdrag 
 



 Vi erbjuder bruttolöneavdrag så att du kan göra smarta ekonomiska val för din framtid. 
 



  
 



 SL-kort 
 



 Vi gör pendlingen enkel med ett SL-kort, så du slipper tänka på biljetter och kan fokusera på att komma dit du behöver. 
 



  
 



 Att få livet att fungera 
 



 Vi vet att det kan vara svårt att balansera arbete och privatliv, därför samarbetar vi med företag som erbjuder rabatterade tjänster för ANIMARUM-anställda, inklusive: barnomsorg, städtjänster och läxhjälp. Allt för att göra ditt liv lite mindre stressigt. 
 



  
 



 Att ge tillbaka till samhället 
 



 Vi tror på kraften i att göra gott. Därför får våra medarbetare varje år möjlighet att donera ett bestämt belopp till en välgörenhet de själva väljer. Oavsett om det handlar om att stötta utbildning, miljön eller människor i behov, ger vi vårt team möjlighet att bidra till det de brinner för. 
 



  
 



 Konkurrenskraftiga löner och optionsprogram 
 



 Vi vet att vår största tillgång är vårt fantastiska team, och vi tycker att det ska återspeglas i lönekuvertet! Därför erbjuder vi flera flexibla och konkurrenskraftiga lönepaket för att passa alla: 
 



  
 



 Oavsett vilket paket du väljer är vi engagerade i att säkerställa att du blir rättvist belönad och att du har friheten att forma din egen inkomst.

title: Backend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer at Viaplay, you’ll work on improving and developing our platform to meet the challenges of a continuously growing user base. Your contributions will directly influence how we attract and convert visitors into loyal users of our commercial streaming platform in our Engineering organization. You’ll contribute to building and refining our backend services, as well as supporting our product teams with a seamless user experience by aligning the backend and tooling.
   

  

 We’re modernizing our services to enhance scalability and performance, and you’ll play a key role in driving this transformation. With a cutting-edge serverless architecture built on Node.js, Rust and AWS, you’ll thrive in an innovative and forward-thinking tech environment.
   

  

 You’ll join a newly formed platform team that’s small but mighty, with members in Stockholm and Barcelona. Our mission? To deliver platform solutions that align with both technical and product visions, focusing on the commercial structure of our streaming service.
   

  

**Here’s What Your Daily Challenges Might Look Like**
* Take ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaborate with other teams transforming our platform into modern solutions
* Participate in weekly guild meetings, contributing to best practices, long-term strategy, and maintaining technical excellence
* Continuously invest in your personal growth and skill development


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Developing services using technologies such as Node.js or Rust
* Strong grasp of object-oriented programming principles
* Familiarity with test-driven or behavior-driven development (TDD/BDD) and related frameworks
* Experience developing services in cloud environments, preferably AWS
* A track record of contributing to refactoring initiatives in a dynamic organization
* Curious and motivated by collaborating with and supporting other teams


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience building state-less, high-transactional end-user products
* Advanced knowledge of AWS services (S3, SQS, Lambda, DynamoDB, etc)


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with three days a week in the office and the rest remote, giving you the best of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Gameplay Programmer
description:
Are you passionate about strategy games? Do you have a solid C++ background? Paradox Development Studio is offering an exciting opportunity for a Gameplay Programmer to join our dedicated team working on our latest grand strategy project, Victoria 3.
   

  

 At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.
   

  

 We invite you to contribute to Victoria 3, a game that simulates a transformative century, starting from 1836. Your input will directly impact the game mechanics and systems, bringing to life our representation of global population dynamics, industrial revolution, and diplomatic endeavors on a grand scale.
   

  

**The Skills We’re Looking For**
* Proficiency in C++, with the ability to develop and maintain well-engineered code, focusing on stability and performance.
* Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, with the aptitude to take full ownership of features from understanding the design to implementing the code.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken, to effectively collaborate in our international team.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills, capable of contributing positively to team dynamics and achieving project goals.


 Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.
   

  

 If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Victoria team!
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Senior .Net Fullstack Developer
description:
At NOBA, we’re all about collaboration, curiosity, and tackling tech challenges together. As part of our skilled dev team, you’ll dive into both backend and frontend work, solving problems with people who genuinely enjoy building great things.
   

  

 We’re forming a brand-new development team in Stockholm and are looking for two
 **Senior .Net Fullstack Developers** 
 to join us. We aim to bring together people with varied backgrounds and experiences, united by a passion for solving tech challenges and building great digital solutions!
   

  

**About The Role**
 You’ll have the chance to work across the full stack, developing new web services, improving system usability, and maintaining existing solutions. You will be trusted in designing, building and implementing modern web services for internal and external users.
   

  

 We’re big on continuous learning and knowledge-sharing - plus, we believe in a healthy work-life balance, giving you time to recharge and pursue your passions outside of work. Join a team of friendly and highly skilled developers, based in the central of Stockholm.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Develop web applications with a focus on great user experiences
* Build internal tools that make life easier for your colleagues
* Lead the full lifecycle of projects, from concept to delivery
* Integrate third-party solutions
* Collaborate closely with fellow developers in an Agile environment.


**We Are Looking For You Who**
 Are a problem solver who’s not afraid to push beyond the comfort zone and try new things. Strong communication and teamwork are essential, and we’re after someone who isn’t shy about sharing their ideas. You’ll need:
   

  

* 5+ years of software development experience
* 3+ years in web development with C#/.Net/.NetCore
* 3+ years working with React or similar JavaScript frameworks
* Experience designing complex solutions with a focus on logical design
* Familiarity with Agile Scrum methodologies
* Experience with relational and document databases
* Fluency in English (written and spoken)


**It's Positive If You Have**
* Experience with Azure or other public cloud platforms
* Fluency in Swedish


 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values:
 **we are wholehearted** 
 ,
 **we collaborate** 
 and
 **we take the lead** 
 .
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page
   

  

  

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data here.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: Senior Java Developer
description:

**Stockholm** 
**, Sweden** 
**(on-site)***
***Schedule: 1 FTE (40 hours per week)***
***Salary: Up to 410 SEK/h***
 We are Baltic Assist, an outsourcing company, specializing in innovative remote career solutions. We provide exciting opportunities on a global level fostering long-term cooperation between top talent and our partners. By cultivating a desirable environment, our people are empowered to excel and engage with a community of diverse professionals. With a commitment to efficiency and innovation, Baltic Assist aims to be the go-to choice for seeking rewarding careers.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 In this role, you’ll act as a go-to expert within the team - supporting colleagues, guiding design decisions, and contributing to the continuous development of complex Java-based systems. You’ll balance working with new features and maintaining legacy code, ensuring long-term stability and usability.

* Develop, maintain, and optimise applications using Java (with a focus on Java Swing).
* Take ownership of important design decisions and system architecture aspects.
* Support and mentor team members by sharing expertise and best practices.
* Quickly adapt to and work effectively with complex and legacy codebases.

* 5+ years of experience in Java development.

**What We Offer**
* Flexible working arrangements and a hybrid work model to help you succeed in your career while balancing personal needs.

* Open and friendly company culture, great colleagues, company events & teambuildings.


*At Baltic Assist, we believe that the strength of our team lies in the diversity of our backgrounds and perspectives. All information collected during the recruitment process will be handled securely and used exclusively for recruitment purposes. Your data will not be shared with unauthorized parties, and it will be retained only as long as necessary for the recruitment process or as required by applicable laws. By applying, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our privacy policy and GDPR guidelines.*

title: ServiceNow Utvecklare
description:
Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi ser att du har några års erfarenhet i mjukvaruutveckling och förvaltning. Meriterande om du har erfarenhet i ServiceNow utveckling (både i standardprodukter som anpassade tillämpningar sk. custom apps).
   

  

 I arbetsuppgifterna ingår:
   

  

* Dialog med beställare användare för att förstå verksamhetens behov
* Ta fram kravspecifikation utifrån behoven
* Arbeta med utveckling och framtagning av lösningen baserad på verksamhetens behov
* Ta fram underlag för prioritering av arbetet
* Kommunicera status på progress
* Testa och verifiera att lösningen uppfyller kraven
* Driftsätta nya lösningen

**Requirements**

**Meriterande om du har kunskaper i:**

title: Developer with a Passion for Applications at StrongPoint
description:
Would you like to help create technological solutions that make a real difference in people’s everyday lives? At StrongPoint, we are on an exciting journey developing innovative products for the future of retail and e-commerce. We’re now looking for a skilled system developer to contribute to our global digital commerce solutions – and above all, someone passionate about writing high-quality code.
   

  

**About The Role**
 With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on the development of mobile applications used by store staff and customers around the world. Your work will focus on building robust, user-friendly, and secure solutions – primarily using C# and .NET.
   

  

 Together with colleagues in Täby and our teams in the Baltics, you will be involved in the entire development cycle – from concept and design to implementation and maintenance. You’ll be part of an agile team that works closely with the business, where your technical drive and problem-solving skills will truly shine.
   

  

 We highly value skilled developers – whether you specialize in mobile apps or broader backend development. What matters most to us is your dedication to code quality, curiosity, and a desire to build long-lasting solutions.
   

  

 This position is based at our office in Täby, with the possibility of hybrid work.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
 You are a dedicated developer who wants to continue growing and contribute your expertise in an ambitious team. You have solid experience with C# and .NET and a desire to work on application-oriented solutions. You enjoy collaborating with others and take responsibility for finding smart technical solutions.
   

  

 We would like you to have:
   

  

* Solid experience in system development with C# and .NET
* A structured approach and good understanding of modern development methodologies
* Proficiency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* Relevant education in system/software development or equivalent practical experience


 It’s a plus if you have experience with:
   

  

* Mobile application development (Xamarin.Forms, .NET MAUI, or similar)
* App distribution and signing for iOS/Android
* Azure DevOps, CI/CD, and automated build pipelines
* Design and architecture patterns (e.g., MVVM, Mediator)
* Integration via RESTful APIs


**About StrongPoint**
 StrongPoint is a leading provider of retail technology and e-commerce solutions. We develop smart systems that streamline retail operations, enhance customer experiences, and shape the future of grocery shopping. With over 500 employees in more than 25 countries, we’ve helped our customers become more productive, cost-efficient, and competitive for over three decades. StrongPoint is listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange and has its headquarters in Norway.
   

  

 Learn more at: www.strongpoint.com/se/om-oss
   

  

**How do you apply?**
 In this recruitment, Strongpoint collaborates with Wise IT. To apply for the position, you simply apply via the link. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible Recruiting Consultant Kristin Mörth, at kristin.morth@wiseit.se. Unfortunately, we cannot accept applications via email as we value your personal integrity. You can read more about how we handle personal data in accordance with GDPR in the Wise Group’s policy for the processing of personal data. We work with an ongoing selection of candidates and may fill the position as soon as we find the right person. Therefore, please submit your application as soon as possible!

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
Capgemini har sedan 2007 varit en strategisk partner med Salesforce, som är ledande i Europa inom strategi, design, implementation och förvaltning av innovativa Salesforce-lösningar. Tillsammans med våra kunder levererar vi på Capgemini helhetslösningar inom hela Salesforce-plattformen, vi är en multi-cloud partner och jobbar bland annat med Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud och Experience Cloud. Vi är en av nordens största aktörer inom Salesforce, vilket ger oss möjligheten att arbeta med spännande uppdrag tillsammans med andra framstående experter inom området.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker nu en erfaren Salesforce utvecklare för en spännande position till vårt Salesforce team på Kungsholmen i centrala Stockholm. Du kommer ingå i ett av våra team som stödjer våra kunders behov inom Salesforce, och kommer arbeta agilt med att utveckla och implementera Salesforces lösningar.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att få:
   

  

* Tillsammas med dina kollegor kommer du att vara uppdaterad och certifierad inom de senaste teknikerna för att säkerställa karriärsutveckling för dig samt affärsnytta för våra kunder.
* Utveckla och anpassa Salesforce-lösningar utifrån kundernas affärsprocesser och behov.
* Möjlighet att få utvecklas som teknisk ledare och/ eller arkitekt.
* Driva våra kunders transformationsresa och blir även en del av vår Salesforce Guild.


**Din profil**
* 3+ års erfarenhet som Salesforce utvecklare där du har arbetat med både anpassad utveckling och övergripande konfigurering av Salesforce i antingen en eller flera projekt.
* Erfarenhet inom Apex, Visualforce och LWC/Aura Components och JavaScript
* Erfarenhet av REST API, SOAP API och Salesforce API´s.
* Erfarenhet av databas och SQL.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Möjlighet till utbildning och certifiering för dig som vill ligga i framkant.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring & tjänstepension.
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden & Work-from-Home Policy.


**Ansökan**
 Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan. Vi kommer att intervjua löpande och ser fram emot att hitta vår nästa kollega. Varmt välkomna med din ansökan!
   

  

*Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller genomförs som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.*
**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Frostbite is EA's proprietary game engine. Its versatile tools and cutting-edge technology power creation on some of the world's most iconic and visually stunning games, including titles from EA SPORTS and Battlefield. Frostbite provides a unified platform that empowers developers to create hyper-realistic worlds, intricate gameplay, and lifelike animations with unmatched speed and quality. By joining Frostbite, you'll be at the forefront of game engine innovation, collaborating with top-tier developers to push the boundaries of interactive realism and immersive gameplay. Shape the future of gaming technology and leave your mark on the next generation of games.
   

  

 Join our dynamic Frostbite Rendering team as a Software Engineer, where you will work directly on the modern Render Hardware Abstraction Layer of the Frostbite engine. You will leverage the full power and features of supported APIs and hardware. Our team develops rendering backends for both current and future platforms and is distributed across North America and Europe. We collaborate with our "customers," the Rendering Engineers, to ensure performance and quality across all supported platforms. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you'll play a vital role in advancing the rendering technology of the Frostbite Renderer, contributing to the success of some of the industry's biggest titles.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Software Engineer on the Rendering Backends team you will:
   

  

* Develop and maintain our low-level, cross-platform graphics hardware abstraction layer for the Frostbite Engine
* Lead performance profiling and optimizations on multiple platforms
* Collaborate with game team engineers and the Frostbite rendering team to deliver new rendering features
* Create and enhance tools that ensure quality experience for render engineers using Frostbite


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Math or related field
* Advanced knowledge of C++ with at least 7 years of professional programming experience in real-time rendering
* Experience working in rendering for multiple shipped titles on current-generation consoles (PS5, XBSX, PC)
* Knowledge in one or more low-level graphics APIs (DX12, Vulkan, console, etc.)
* Familiarity of modern CPU/GPU hardware architectures
* Proficient with Graphics Debugging Tools (PIX, Renderdoc, console, etc.)
* Experience with memory management and multi-threading with related debugging and optimization experience


**Bonus Qualifications**
* Professional experience working on Device Drivers.
* Professional experience developing graphics debugging tools / utilities / visualizers.
* Experience using source control systems (p4, git) in large code bases


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: PAM Developer
description:
Our client in the banking sector is seeking a skilled
 **PAM/CyberArk Developer** 
 to join their Privileged Access Management (PAM) project. You will be responsible for developing application connectors, extending PAM controls across the organization, and ensuring a smooth on-boarding process. This role requires both technical expertise and the ability to collaborate with stakeholders to deliver secure and efficient solutions.
 



  





**Job Title:** 
 PAM/CyberArk Developer
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm OR Oslo OR Helsinki - 2 Days a Week in the Office - 3 Days Remote
 



**Duration:** 
 6 Month Extendable Contract
 



**Start Date:** 
 September / October
 



  





  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Support the PAM project as a developer in full-scope on-boarding.
* Develop application connectors and extend PAM controls across the organization.
* Collect and analyze relevant data to optimize the on-boarding pipeline.
* Provide PAM technical expertise and guidance.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure effective implementation of PAM solutions.
* Maintain high-quality documentation and adhere to security best practices.



  





**Must-Have Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience with PAM controls and requirements.
* Hands-on experience developing within CyberArk.
* Strong stakeholder collaboration and negotiation skills.
* Knowledge of identity and PAM security best practices (on-premise & cloud).
* Solid understanding of fundamental security principles (SoD, Least Privilege, Zero Trust).
* Experience working in DevOps teams within Agile/Scrum setups.
* Familiarity with IT processes, SDLC, and cybersecurity frameworks (CIS, COBIT, NIST, ISO 2700x).



  





**What We Offer:** 



* A challenging and impactful role within a leading banking organization.
* Opportunity to work with cutting-edge PAM technologies.
* A collaborative and supportive team environment.

title: Senior Embedded System Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software & Platforms team with a Senior Embedded System Developer.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As a Senior Embedded System Developer at Marshall Group, you will be navigating through the lower layers of our systems and the intricacies of controlling the hardware to bring the true rock’n’roll experience. You’ll be part of an exciting journey to build our embedded platform and development environment. You will have the opportunity to share your art of writing drivers connecting crucial components of the system, master the nuances of seamless connectivity, and navigate through layers of complexity to bring up simplicity.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Develop embedded software for audio systems.
* Architect board support packages (BSP).
* Innovate in audio-related module development.
* Implement modular code for a platform supporting a multitude of products.
* Participate in code review and documentation.
* Explore by working on proof of Concepts (PoC).
* Improve build systems and product testing.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 As a Senior Embedded System Developer, you have effective communication, a sharp problem-solving ability, and a strong sense of team collaboration. It's also important to have the ability to approach challenges with creative and innovative solutions and be ready to adapt to new technologies in a fast-paced environment. A few years' experience in a role as a Senior Embedded System Developer or similar.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* Expert-level proficiency in C
* Experience working with real-time operating systems (FreeRTOS, Zephyr, or similar)
* Previous work on embedded systems based on microcontrollers (MCU)
* Solid understanding of MCU architecture and various peripherals
* Knowledge of Python
* Familiarity with tools such as Git, Make, or CMake
* Familiarity with Bluetooth, BLE, and Wi-Fi technologies
* Bonus if you have experience with:
+ GCC toolchain, bash, and Linux
+ Knowledge of Rust and C++ programming languages


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Business Developer
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies that value data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Business Developer you are at the core of the sales team, helping accelerating our growth by expanding the use of our platform to new customers.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Passionate about business development and interested in AI
* Solution-oriented with an entrepreneurial spirit who gets things done
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, agile environment
* We think you have 1-2 years of experience in similar roles or demonstrable achievements in relevant areas. Experience with a startup is considered extra relevant.
* Fluent in Swedish, social, driven, and eager to learn new things
* Proficiency in especially Norwegian or German, but other European languages as well is considered a strong plus (not a requirement but highly valued).


**Key Responsibilities**
 As a part of our sales team, one of your primary responsibilities is to bring our revolutionary product to both new and existing markets. This will include executing activities such as:
   

  

* Talking to potential customers and understand their needs
* Negotiating and closing deals
* Sourcing and initiating potential partnership opportunities
* Do what it takes to hit targets and deadlines, which might include proactive demand generation and finding creative ways to build the sales pipeline


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of building a system and company that defines the future
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options

title: Embedded Software Engineer - Core OS
description:
**About Applied Intuition**
 Applied Intuition is the vehicle intelligence company that accelerates the global adoption of safe, AI-driven machines. Founded in 2017, Applied Intuition delivers the toolchain, Vehicle OS, and autonomy stacks to help customers build intelligent vehicles and shorten time to market. Eighteen of the top 20 global automakers and major programs across the Department of Defense trust Applied Intuition's solutions to deliver vehicle intelligence. Applied Intuition services the automotive, defense, trucking, construction, mining, and agriculture industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Washington, D.C., San Diego, CA, Ft. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor, MI, London, Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at appliedintuition.com.
   

  

*We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments. (Note: For EpiSci job openings, fully remote work will be considered by exception.)*
**Meet our engineers on the Vehicle OS team!**
 Vehicle OS is a flexible suite of products that help vehicle manufacturers develop, deploy, and update complete vehicle software and AI applications. This is one of the fastest growing projects here at Applied, and we are seeking exceptional talent to drive execution.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for senior software engineers with expertise in developing embedded software applications on production computers to build the next-generation vehicle platform! It is a unique opportunity to work on challenging engineering problems while being part of a fast-moving team.
   

  

 At Applied Intuition, you will:
   

  

* Architect and develop highly reliable embedded software
* Integrate vendor components into a common software framework, ensuring proper low-level communication (e.g., CAN, LIN, I2C, SPI, UART etc.)
* Implement real-time operating system (RTOS) applications as required for the product
* Drive custom in-vehicle infotainment device solutions
* Implement best practices in embedded AOSP development, HAL customization, and Android middleware, including maintenance and security
* Develop and customize Linux-based Android services, embedded services, and Android applications for compatibility across various Android versions and devices
* Work with cross-functional teams to bring up custom software on new devices, productionize it, and manage the process for maintaining company products


 We're looking for someone who has:
   

  

* 6+ years of experience working on embedded devices
* Strong background in embedded software development using C/C++ and assembly languages
* Hands-on experience with Android Board Support Package (BSP), Android middleware, HAL customization and maintenance
* Advanced software debugging skills, with a strong focus on low-level hardware debugging to ensure full system operation, and debugging Android Native Crashes, system crashes, and Android middleware (Drivers, HAL, Libraries, Framework)
* Experience developing software for complex embedded systems and custom SoCs, with expertise in peripheral interfaces like UART, SPI, CSI-2, I2C, GPIO, USB, and PCIe


 Nice to have:
   

  

* Prior experience in developing on-vehicle technology
* Ability to work with safety-critical robotic systems with real-time constraints
* Proficiency in embedded systems testing, with experience enhancing automated test frameworks
* Experience in creating Android device builds to support Android system development, RTOS and middleware applications, and strong knowledge of writing, modifying, and maintaining Linux services under SELinux
* Proven ability to design, integrate, and deliver code into production environments within aggressive timelines


 Compensation at Applied Intuition for eligible roles includes base salary, equity, and benefits. Base salary is a single component of the total compensation package, which may also include equity in the form of options and/or restricted stock units, comprehensive health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance coverage, 401k retirement benefits with employer match, learning and wellness stipends, and paid time off. Note that benefits are subject to change and may vary based on jurisdiction of employment.
   

  

 Applied Intuition pay ranges reflect the minimum and maximum intended target base salary for new hire salaries for the position. The actual base salary offered to a successful candidate will additionally be influenced by a variety of factors including experience, credentials & certifications, educational attainment, skill level requirements, interview performance, and the level and scope of the position.
   

  

 Please reference the job posting’s subtitle for where this position will be located. For pay transparency purposes, the base salary range for this full-time position in the location listed is: $171,000 - $264,000 USD annually.
   

  

*Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*
*Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.*

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
**About Tzeract**
 Tzeract is changing the way we bet on sports. As Kambi’s in-house startup, we've built a completely new platform from the ground up - with our own AI at the core, not just as an add-on. Today we already handle over 500 millions bets in distributed systems with a low latency, and your work will be scaled globally from day one.
   

  

 We iterate quickly, decide fast, and your calendar stays free for the work that matters. This gives you time for coffee breaks, test ideas and solve problems together. In this role, you’ll help shape both the product and parts of the architecture. It’s the combination of startup freedom with an enterprise touch - and your contributions will be visible and felt by millions of users worldwide.
   

  

**What's our current focus?** 
 Well, exploring new sports markets. For you as a developer, that means diving into the rules of the game and turning them into code - building the odds infrastructure, creating models that run in real time. It's a fun and collaborative playground with a clear goal: creating the next generation of how sports, data, and AI come together - built from scratch, with impact at its core.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 This is not your usual software engineering role. At Tzeract, you'll be the bridge between software engineers and quant engineers - ensuring the models we build are optimized and able to be deployed to our cloud infrastructure. It's therefore a strong merit to find mathematical challenges exciting, since it will play a part of your daily work.
   

  

 You'll collaborate in small teams of engineers (+20 people) with expertise in quantitative analysis, data, and AI. Together, you’ll develop systems that analyze real-time data, delivering personalized experiences to sports fans everywhere.
   

  

 Tzeract is a fast-paced startup, where scope or roadmap can shift to align with future goals. If this excites you, along with a hybrid work setup and a central office location, we’d love to get to know you better.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices using Python & AWS technologies.
* Implement best practices in SWE, including CI/CD, containerization, and automated testing to ensure quality and speed of deployment.
* Collaborate with software and quant engineers - as well as scientists to integrate AI models and algorithms into production systems efficiently.
* Contribute to improvements on both technical and operational aspects of our daily work.


**What we believe you have:**
* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or a related field (a PhD in Mathematics is a plus).
* Solid experience in Python and/or experience with low-level languages (C++ is a plus).
* 5+ years of software development experience or similar, with the ability to quickly adapt to new technologies.
* Experience with modern DevOps tools and practices, including Docker, Jenkins, or similar.
* Great communicator, able to own your projects and gather colleagues when needed to solve complex problems.


**Note** 
 . We will only be able to consider candidates living in Sweden for this position.
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Staff Software Engineer - Content Experience Platform
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***








**Who We Are…**





 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
 









 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
 




  


 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
 




  


**Your New Role...** 








 The Direct to Consumer (DTC) Group is a technology company within Warner Bros Discovery. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT), and a suite of applications to support all of our network’s brands globally. We are building modern container-based micro-services operated on AWS. Our platform covers everything from search, content catalogue, video transcoding, personalization, to global subscriptions, and much more. We enable performant streaming experiences across connected TVs, web, mobile phones, tablets, and consoles for a large footprint of WBD owned streaming services (HBO Max, Discovery+, CNN, and others). This is a growing, global engineering group crucial to WBD’s future.
 







 We are hiring a Staff Software Engineer within the DTC Content Experience Platform. The team is responsible for aggregating, enabling, and serving the personalized Content Discovery experience within our DTC streaming video platforms through our Experience Services APIs. We ensure all client applications worldwide have seamless access to the latest and relevant content metadata, personalized browse experiences and curations, and presentational elements to deliver a best-in-class content discovery experience to our hundreds of millions of streaming users globally across our different streaming service platforms.
 



  


**Your Role Accountabilities...** 



* Shape the long-term technical direction of major workstreams in close partnership with Engineering peers, Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, and Designers.
* Lead system design and development of large, complex features and infrastructure, either in new domains or across multiple existing systems.
* Partner with other technical leaders to drive successful end-to-end delivery, from discovery and planning through execution and operations.
* Support the growth and development of engineers in your workstreams through coaching, design collaboration, and fostering technical excellence.
* Define and uphold standards for code quality, operational excellence, and reliable delivery across teams.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define MVPs, milestones, and product requirements that align engineering efforts with business outcomes.
* Drive architectural decisions that enable scalability, reliability, and adaptability for the future.
* Identify and address gaps, bottlenecks, or misalignments—working proactively to ensure long-term success for your team and the organization.



  


**Qualifications and Experience...** 



* At least 8 years of experience with deep expertise in Java or other JVM-based languages, including advanced language features, performance tuning, and designing systems for scale and reliability.
* Extensive experience building and operating cloud-native applications using Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS, including architecture design and production deployment.
* Strong command of distributed systems, microservice architectures, and synchronous /asynchronous communication patterns using technologies like gRPC and Kafka.
* Proven ability to design and evolve high-performance, low-latency APIs and backend systems that serve real-time, high-throughput workloads.
* Practical and architectural-level experience with persistence and caching technologies such as PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, and Caffeine, including data modeling and performance optimization.
* Deep understanding of observability and tracing, with experience driving adoption of tools like OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, or Zipkin to improve system transparency and incident response.
* Experience defining and scaling infrastructure as code practices using Terraform, Helm, ArgoCD, and GitOps workflows.
* Ability to establish robust monitoring, alerting, and logging systems using tools such as Prometheus, CloudWatch, Kibana, and PagerDuty, and ensure teams operate systems with confidence.
* Familiarity with non-blocking, asynchronous, and reactive programming paradigms, including frameworks like Spring WebFlux or Vert.x, and when to apply them effectively.
* Comfortable evaluating, introducing, and scaling technical choices across multiple teams to drive engineering velocity and system robustness.























  


**How We Get Things Done…**









 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at
 












 www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/
 











  
 
 along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
 








**Championing Inclusion at WBD**



 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
 









 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our
 
 accessibility page
 
 for instructions to submit your request.

title: Business Developer - Swedish Speaking
description:
**Business Developer – Leyton Sverige**
**Om Leyton Sweden:** 
 Leyton Sverige är en del av Leyton Group och etablerades 2021 i Sverige. Vi är specialiserade på att hjälpa innovativa och tillverkande företag att få tillgång till finansiering för att utveckla sina verksamheter och behålla sin konkurrenskraft. Genom våra högkvalitativa finansiella konsulttjänster gör vi en verklig skillnad för både våra kunder och Sveriges ekonomi.
   

  

**Vad gör vi?** 
 På Leyton hjälper vi företag att optimera sina kostnader och öka sina besparingar genom innovativa finansiella lösningar. Våra tjänster är anpassade för att stödja deras tillväxt och utveckling. Med vår unika success fee -modell betalar kunden endast om de faktiskt gör extra besparingar. Vi tar inga förskottsavgifter eller kräver att budgetar ska planeras i förväg – vårt mål är att alla potentiella kunder ska kunna ta del av våra tjänster utan risk.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen som Business Developer?**
 Som Business Developer hos oss har du en nyckelroll i att driva företagets tillväxt. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Ringa och boka möten med C-level-chefer inom en rad olika branscher.
* Delta i möten och kvalificera potentiella kunder.
* Stänga affärer och skapa långvariga kundrelationer.
* Ansvara för att hålla CRM-systemet uppdaterat.


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Är driven av att nå mål och överträffa förväntningar.
* Trivs med att arbeta i en prestationsbaserad miljö där du har stor påverkan på din egen lön.
* Har en stark vilja att utvecklas och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Gillar utmaningar och att kliva utanför din komfortzon.
* Är nyfiken och vill vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa.


**Varför ska du inte söka denna tjänst?**
* Om du ogillar att arbeta mot uppsatta mål och deadlines.
* Om du inte är intresserad av att utvecklas och ta till dig feedback.
* Om du föredrar en statisk arbetsmiljö och vill hålla dig inom din komfortzon.


**Varför ska du söka denna tjänst?**
* Om du vill sälja en tjänst som verkligen gör skillnad för företag och samhället.
* Om du tror att det är enkelt att sälja tjänster som i praktiken är "gratis" för kunden.
* Om du älskar känslan av att skriva under avtal och stänga affärer.
* Om du vill utveckla dina försäljningsfärdigheter och få direkt påverkan på din lön genom en attraktiv provisionsmodell utan tak.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att växa.
* En attraktiv provisionsmodell utan tak.
* Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter inom försäljning och affärsutveckling.
* Möjligheten att påverka både företagets och din egen framgång.
* Teamkänsla där du är en del av ett företag som uppskattar och belönar dina prestationer.
* 30 dagars semester, privat sjukvårdsförsäkring och pensionsförmåner.


**Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär? Sluta läsa och kom väx med oss!**

title: Salesforce System Owner
job_function: Information Technology, Project Management, and Sales
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
*Are you a Salesforce professional with development skills? Do you enjoy owning and optimizing systems end-to-end? Join Tacton as our Salesforce System Owner, where you'll play a pivotal role in scaling our Salesforce ecosystem to support our growing business operations.* 




  





**About The Role** 




 You'll be part of our Revenue Operations team, collaborating cross-functionally with a group of engaged and talented colleagues. You’ll place yourself in the shoes of internal business users, work with process flow charts to help visualize problems and proposed solutions, leverage AI to be more efficient and own/deliver the changes that need to be made – In short, you will be the Salesforce subject matter expert that has the platform expertise to drive change!
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 



* Platform Ownership: Manage the full Salesforce platform, including user management, permissions, profiles, roles, and record types.
* Declarative Automation: Design, build, and optimize Salesforce Flows, validation rules, formula fields, and Lightning UI enhancements.
* Programmatic Development: Develop and maintain Apex classes, triggers, and test methods to support custom business logic.
* Governance & Documentation: Ensure platform governance, maintain comprehensive documentation, and uphold scalability best practices.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Product teams to gather requirements and implement solutions.
* What You Bring Experience: Hands-on Salesforce experience in a combined Admin/Developer role.
* Technical Skills: Proficiency in Salesforce Flows, Apex development, and data management.
* Platform Knowledge: Solid understanding of the Salesforce data model, security model, and platform limits.
* Tools Familiarity: Experience with tools like Data Loader and VS Code.
* Languages: Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written.



  





**Qualifications (not a Requirement)** 



* Salesforce certifications (e.g., Platform Developer I, Admin).
* Knowledge of JavaScript, Python, or other scripting languages.
* Marketing Automation (e.g., Pardot, Hubspot)
* Middleware (e.g., Mulesoft, Workato)
* CPQ (e.g., Zuora, Kugamon, Tacton)
* DocGen (e.g., Docusign)
* Revenue Intelligence (Gong, Salesloft, Outreach, ZoomInfo)



  





**Who You Are** 




 We’re looking for someone who is eager to understand our business, who brings strong initiative and a passion for continuous improvement and development. In this role, you’ll collaborate with colleagues across all functions and roles – so being an excellent collaborator and communicator is key.
 



**What We Offer** 



* Ownership: Full ownership of a strategic, business-critical platform.
* Culture: A collaborative, open, and inclusive culture built on trust and innovation.
* Impact: The opportunity to make a tangible difference across teams.
* Benefits: 33 vacation days, private healthcare insurance, a generous wellness allowance, and more.



**About Tacton** 




 Tacton is a global SaaS leader in CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), empowering manufacturers to streamline complex sales processes and drive growth. Headquartered in Stockholm with offices in Chicago, Karlsruhe, and Warsaw, we’re a 220-person team on an exciting growth journey. Recognized by Gartner as a market leader, our technology helps global manufacturers solve real-world configuration challenges and stay competitive in a rapidly changing world. Learn more at tacton.com/about
 



 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Senior Enterprise Account Executive, Growth
description:
MongoDB’s mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build anywhere—on the edge, on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 developers joining MongoDB every month, it’s no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a hardworking, driven individual with superb energy, passion and initiative for new business acquisition. The Account Executive role focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a sales strategy within an assigned territory, resulting in revenue growth and new customer acquisition.
   

  

 We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Stockholm for our hybrid working model.
   

  

**About The Sales Culture**
 MongoDB is always developing and innovating — not only in our technology, but also in our sales go-to-market strategy. Our sales leadership is committed to building the best salesforce in technology. This means, inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team. We not only equip you to be successful and close deals, but we want your feedback and input on how we can continue to “Think Big and Go Far.” As a crucial part of the Sales team at MongoDB, you will have access to a lucrative market and learn how to sell from some of the most successful sales leaders in the software industry.
   

  

 What you will be doing
   

  

* Proactively, identify, qualify and close a sales pipeline
* Strategically prospect into CTOs, Engineering/IT Leaders, & technical end users
* Build strong and effective relationships, resulting in growth opportunities
* Partner with our Solution Architects and work closely with the Professional Services team to achieve customer satisfaction
* Work closely with the enterprise ecosystem partner sales and channel partner to maximize deal sizes


 What you will bring to the table
   

  

* 4+ years field experience of quota-carrying experience in a fast-paced and competitive market
* Demonstrated ability to open new accounts and run a complex sales process
* A proven track record of overachievement and hitting sales targets
* Ability to articulate the business value of complex enterprise technology
* Skilled in building business champions
* Driven and competitive. Possess a strong desire to be successful


 Things we love
   

  

* Passionate about growing your career in the largest market in software (database)
* Previous Sales Methodology training (e.g. MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales)
* Familiarity with databases, develops and open source technology a plus


 Why join now
   

  

* Accelerators up to 30%
* Best in breed Sales trainings in MEDDIC and Command of the Message, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamps and development programs
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
* Generous and competitive benefits (parental leave, fertility & wellbeing support)


 To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!
   

  

 MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.
   

  

 MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.
   

  

 Req ID: 425108

title: Utvecklare
description:
**LEONH SÖKER BACKEND-FOKUSERAD FULLSTACK-UTVECKLARE** 




 Leonh är den snabbväxande utmanaren som skakar om corporate finance marknaden. Vi kombinerar smartare verktyg, modern teknik och en arbetskultur som gör jobbet både roligare och mer givande. Nu letar vi efter en erfaren backend-utvecklare med fullstack-kompetens – en teknisk problemlösare som vill bygga de robusta systemen bakom vår framgång och driva vår tekniska utveckling framåt.
 



  





**Vad kommer du göra hos oss?** 




 Som backend-fokuserad utvecklare på Leonh får du ansvaret för att bygga och skalförstora de kärnteknologier som driver våra produkter. Du kommer jobba i hela teknikstacken men med tyngdpunkten på serverside-utveckling och systemarkitektur. Hos oss handlar utveckling om att skapa verklig affärsnytta genom skalbar, robust och innovativ teknik. Bland annat kommer du att:
 



  




* **Arkitekta och utveckla** 
  våra backend-system med TypeScript/Node.js för att hantera komplexa affärslogiker och dataflöden
* **Designa och optimera** 
  PostgreSQL-databaser och datastrukturer som stödjer våra växande tjänster
* **Bygga och underhålla** 
  API:er och systemintegration som möjliggör smidig frontend-upplevelse
* **Implementera säkerhetslösningar** 
  och datahantering för finansiella tjänster med höga krav på säkerhet
* **Driva AI-initiativ** 
  och integrera intelligenta funktioner i våra backend-system
* **Samarbeta med frontend-teamet** 
  för att leverera end-to-end-lösningar med fokus på prestanda och användbarhet
* **Vara med och ta tekniska beslut** 
  och påverka vår systemarkitektur – vi tror på att ge utvecklare rätt mandat



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi letar efter en backend-fokuserad fullstack-utvecklare som:
 


* Har 
 **5+ års erfarenhet** 
  av backend-utveckling och systemarkitektur
* Har 
 **gedigen erfarenhet** 
  av Node.js/TypeScript för serverside-utveckling
* Har 
 **stark kunskap** 
  inom PostgreSQL, datamodellering och databasoptimering
* Har 
 **erfarenhet av React** 
  och förstår frontend-backend-interaktion
* Har arbetat med 
 **API-design, prestanda och skalbarhet** 
  i produktionsmiljö
* Kan 
 **balansera teknisk kvalitet med leveranstempo** 
  – du förstår när det är dags att optimera vs leverera
* Har 
 **intresse för AI-teknologier** 
  och hur de integreras i backend-system



  





**Varför Leonh?** 




 På Leonh kommer du in i ett snabbväxande bolag där din tekniska expertis direkt påverkar vår framgång. Vi erbjuder:
 


* **Teknisk påverkan** 
  – bygg system som faktiskt används av riktiga kunder varje dag
* **Arkitekturansvar** 
  – forma hur vi bygger skalbar och säker fintech-infrastruktur
* **Ett litet expertteam** 
  - där dina tekniska beslut får genomslag och uppskattas
* **Individuell utveckling** 
  - med stort fokus på att du ska växa som senior backend-utvecklare
* **AI-transformation** 
  – var med och implementera cutting-edge AI-lösningar i finansbranschen



  





**Meriterande** 



* Tidigare erfarenhet av 
 **fintech eller finansiella tjänster**
* Erfarenhet av 
 **AI/ML-integration** 
  i backend-system
* Kunskap om 
 **LLM-teknologier, embeddings** 
  eller promptengineering

title: Systemutvecklare med AI-kompetens
description:
🚀
 **Bli en del av VIPAS AB som Systemutvecklare med AI-kompetens** 
 🚀
   

  

 Tycker du om att bygga intelligenta mjukvarulösningar som kombinerar backend, frontend och AI-teknologi? På VIPAS AB möjliggör vi för innovativa utvecklingsteam att skapa produkter som har verklig påverkan.
   

  

 Som Systemutvecklare kommer du att arbeta nära andra utvecklare och systemingenjörer för att designa, implementera, testa och dokumentera mjukvara för videoinspelning, analys och presentation inom flygtrafikledningssystem. Du kommer bidra med prototyper, fullständiga lösningar och automatiserade testningsramverk, samtidigt som du använder både frontend- och backendkompetens.
   

  

 👉
 **Nyckelkompetenser:**
* Stark erfarenhet av Java och Python för systemutveckling
* Praktisk erfarenhet av AI och maskininlärning, inklusive arbete med språkmodeller
* Integration av Large Language Models (LLMs) via REST-API:er (t.ex. OpenAI, Mistral)
* Kunskap om frontendramverk (React, Vue eller motsvarande)
* Erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling (TDD) och automatiserad testning
* Kunskap om utvecklingsverktyg såsom IntelliJ, Jenkins och Artifactory
* Meriterande: erfarenhet av RAG, LangChain, LlamaIndex, Quarkus, C++, CUDA


 📩
 **Intresserad?** 
 Ansök idag och bli en del av VIPAS AB för att utveckla banbrytande AI-drivna mjukvarulösningar!
   

  

 Sökande måste ha giltigt EU-arbetstillstånd.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Vill du jobba med modern teknik, i ett litet och tight team där du får både ansvar, påverkansmöjlighet och roligt på jobbet? Hemglass söker nu en senior systemutvecklare som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala lösningar!
 




  





 Hemglass är ett av Sveriges mest älskade varumärken och en IT-intensiv verksamhet där tekniken spelar en avgörande roll för både verksamheten och kundernas upplevelse. Nu växlar Hemglass upp och stärker IT-teamet med en erfaren utvecklare som vill vara med på en spännande resa där innovation och kundvärde står i centrum.
 



 Hos Hemglass får du chansen att arbeta i ett dynamiskt och entreprenöriellt IT-team där idéer snabbt blir verklighet. Hemglass kontor ligger centralt i Stockholm och du blir en del av ett tight team – med stort utrymme att sätta avtryck i Hemglass tekniska framtid.
 



  





**OM ROLLEN** 




 Som senior fullstackutvecklare på Hemglass blir ditt primära fokus utveckling och kodning. Du kommer arbeta nära ditt IT-team i ett verksamhetsnära sammanhang, men med en tydlig teknisk tyngdpunkt.
 



 I starten kommer du ha en central roll i att ta hem ett internt system – med ansvar för migrering, vidareutveckling och anpassning. Därefter fortsätter du att bygga och förädla både interna system och kundnära digitala lösningar i Hemglass moderna teknikstack.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Utveckla och vidareutveckla fullstack-lösningar iC#/.NET och moderna webbtekniker.
* Ansvara för migrering, anpassning och vidareutveckling av ett internt system
* Skriva ren, säker och testbar kod med fokus på långsiktig kvalitet och prestanda.
* Bidra till teamets tekniska diskussioner och ibland ge input eller stöd till kollegor.
* Delta i utvecklingen av Hemglass app och andra digitala lösningar.



  





**OM DIG** 




 Du är en erfaren utvecklare som trivs bäst när du får skriva kod och lösa problem på djupet. Du är en glad, nyfiken och engagerad person som har en passion för programmering. Du ser dig själv som lite av en
 
 kodnörd – och vill hela tiden lära dig nytt samtidigt som du står stadigt i din erfarenhet och kompetens.
 



 Du gillar att arbeta i team och att ibland stötta en mer junior kollega ser du som naturligt och givande.
 



 Du är analytisk, noggrann och brinner för att skapa hållbara och smarta lösningar. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska, både i tal och skrift, och har goda kunskaper i engelska.
 



  





**Vi ser att du har:** 



* Mycket goda kunskaper i C#/.NET
* Praktisk erfarenhet av HTML, CSS och JavaScript/TypeScript
* Kunskap inom React och NodeJS
* Erfarenhet av minst en molnplattform: Azure, AWS eller GCP
* Vana vid källkodshantering (GitHub, Azure DevOps eller liknande)
* Erfarenhet av testning (minst manuell, gärna automatiserad)
* Naturligt säkerhetstänk i ditt dagliga kodande
* Erfarenhet av geodata, geografiska applikationer eller komplexa tids-/avståndsberäkningar.



  





**Meriterande kunskaper** 



* Serverless och eventdrivna arkitekturer
* GraphQL
* CI/CD och pipeline-automation
* UI/UX-design
* Grundläggande förståelse för infrastruktur
* Intresse för helhetslösningar och arkitektur



  





**OM HEMGLASS** 




 Hemglass erbjuder en inspirerande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö där du får vara med och forma framtidens IT-lösningar. Företaget värderar innovation och teknik, och du kommer att arbeta i ett dynamiskt och engagerat IT-team med stor påverkan på verksamheten. Hemglass har en modern teknikstack och ett nära ledarskap som stöttar din utveckling.
 



 Huvudkontoret ligger centralt i Stockholm, där du ingår i ett familjärt team och har möjlighet till distansarbete några dagar i veckan. Hemglass erbjuder bra förmåner som kollektivavtal, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag och självklart – tillgång till glass!
 



  





**ANSÖKAN** 




 Hoppas att vi har väckt ditt intresse och att du är nyfiken på att veta mer om rollen. Vi rekryterar löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart du kan. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail men har du specifika frågor kring tjänsten får du gärna kontakta oss på 
 **jobb@switchgame.se** 




  





**OM SWITCH GAME** 




 Switch Game är rekrytering- och konsultbyrån som gör de krångliga enkelt, superenkelt. Genom att kombinera beprövade metoder med moderna arbetssätt och ny teknik kan vi hitta unika matchningar, snabbt och med hög träffsäkerhet. Vi arbetar alltid tvåvägs och söker kandidater till uppdrag såväl som uppdrag till kandidat vilket skapar en dynamisk organisation med många spännande möjligheter.

title: Developer with a Passion for Applications at StrongPoint
description:
Would you like to help create technological solutions that make a real difference in people’s everyday lives? At StrongPoint, we are on an exciting journey developing innovative products for the future of retail and e-commerce. We’re now looking for a skilled system developer to contribute to our global digital commerce solutions – and above all, someone passionate about writing high-quality code.
   

  

**About The Role**
 With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on the development of mobile applications used by store staff and customers around the world. Your work will focus on building robust, user-friendly, and secure solutions – primarily using C# and .NET.
   

  

 Together with colleagues in Täby and our teams in the Baltics, you will be involved in the entire development cycle – from concept and design to implementation and maintenance. You’ll be part of an agile team that works closely with the business, where your technical drive and problem-solving skills will truly shine.
