Please be aware that HARMAN recruiters will always communicate with you from an '@harman.com' email address. We will never ask for payments, banking, credit card, personal financial information or access to your LinkedIn/email account during the screening, interview, or recruitment process. If you are asked for such information or receive communication from an email address not ending in '@harman.com' about a job with HARMAN, please cease communication immediately and report the incident to us through: harmancareers@harman.com.  

HARMAN is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. HARMAN strives to hire the best qualified candidates and is committed to building a workforce representative of the diverse marketplaces and communities of our global colleagues and customers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.HARMAN attracts, hires, and develops employees based on merit, qualifications and job-related performance.(www.harman.com)
company_description: HARMAN is an innovative technology leader that is rapidly on the move. We empower our global teams to do their best as they take on the big challenges that make life better.

title: IT-Technician
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Flower is Flexible Power. We are a next-gen energy company leveraging AI and machine learning to make renewable energy stable and always available – even when the sun isn’t shining and the wind isn’t blowing.
   

  

 Through smart optimization and trading of energy assets like wind and solar farms, battery systems, and EV chargers, we make renewable energy reliable and predictable, leading the charge towards the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled
 **I** 
 T-Technician.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 The candidate will join a vibrant and dynamic workplace, with the opportunity to make a lasting impact on Flower’s journey and the freedom to shape both the role and the solutions. They will play a key role in ensuring the availability, security, and effective management of the company’s IT ecosystem and the employee endpoints. The role involves close collaboration with relevant colleagues such as the Security Officer and COO.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Manage and configure software suites such as Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, and Atlassian
* Install, configure, and update hardware and software (e.g., PCs, Macs, Microsoft Intune, and Defender) to ensure smooth operations and security
* Handle onboarding, offboarding and access management
* Provide technical support to employees and troubleshoot hardware and software issues
* Research and implement the best solutions and tools based on specific needs and situations
* Follow security principles and best practices to safeguard infrastructure and endpoints
* Contribute to the development of IT guidelines, roadmaps and procurement
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address IT needs


**Who You Are**
* Curious and solution-oriented
* Have a strong team mindset while also being able to work independently
* Comfortable initiating and running projects from scratch, and unafraid to make mistakes
* Security-aware and mindful of best practices
* Hold an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or have equivalent working experience
* Have at least 2 years of relevant work experience in a similar role


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 30 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Talent Partner, Security Officer, COO and our CEO.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Onsite Support Technician
description:
Är du en skicklig IT-tekniker med erfarenhet av klientnära hårdvara?
 



 Vi på Akkodis söker nu en
 **Onsite Support Technician** 
 till ett spännande konsultuppdrag hos en av våra kunder i Järfälla. Uppdraget är på 12 månader med möjlighet till förlängning.
 



 Vi söker kandidater som har kort uppsägningstid eller kan starta omgående.
 



  





**Om uppdraget** 




 Vår kund driver en verksamhet med höga krav på tillgänglighet och stabilitet. Som konsult kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att installera, leverera och koppla in datorer och annan klientnära hårdvara, samt lösa problem där fysisk närvaro krävs.
 



 Du blir en del av ett team som arbetar nära verksamheten och är med och säkerställer att IT-miljön fungerar sömlöst för användarna. Arbetet sker i en dynamisk miljö där servicekänsla och flexibilitet är avgörande.
 



  





**Din roll – Onsite Support Technician** 




 Som tekniker kommer du att:
 


* Installera, leverera och koppla in datorer och annan hårdvara på plats
* Utföra felsökning och lösa problem som kräver fysisk närvaro
* Säkerställa att användarna får rätt stöd och en fungerande IT-miljö
* Bidra till kontinuerlig förbättring av arbetssätt och rutiner



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* 1–3 års erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter inom IT-support eller onsite-teknik
* God förståelse för klientnära hårdvara och Windows-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av installation, leverans och felsökning på plats



 Meriterande:
 


* Kunskap om Active Directory, remote access tools eller MDM-lösningar



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 



* Serviceinriktad med ett coachande mindset
* Prestigelös och flexibel i ditt arbetssätt
* Ansvarstagande och lösningsorienterad
* God kommunikativ förmåga och trivs i direktkontakt med användare



  





**Varför uppdraget är spännande** 



* Du arbetar nära verksamheten och blir en nyckelperson för att IT-miljön fungerar i vardagen
* Du får möjlighet att utveckla dina tekniska och kommunikativa färdigheter i en varierad roll
* Du blir del av ett team med hög kompetens och stark gemenskap



  





**Övrig information** 



* **Placeringsort:** 
 Järfälla
* **Anställningsform:** 
 Konsultuppdrag, 12 månader med möjlighet till förlängning. Vi erbjuder trygga villkor och är anslutna till kollektivavtal.
* **Tillträde:** 
 Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse



  





 Kontakt
 



 Låter detta intressant? Skicka in din ansökan tillsammans med CV och ifylld kravmatris redan idag!
 



 För frågor, kontakta ansvarig Business Manager:
 



**Joanna Nyström – joanna.nystrom@akkodisgroup.com** 




  





**Om Akkodis** 




 På Akkodis strävar vi efter att våra konsulter ska utvecklas och lyckas i sina uppdrag. Vi erbjuder uppdrag i olika branscher och miljöer, ett brett nätverk och kollektivavtal med försäkringar och friskvårdsbidrag. Våra tjänster inom IT och Engineering kännetecknas av kvalitet, snabbhet och enkelhet. Akkodis finns representerat globalt med över 50 000 kollegor i uppdrag varje dag.
 



  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: End User Computing Manager
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?** 




  





 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.
 



 We are now looking for an End User Computing Manager to join our Enterprise IT team.
 



  





**How You’ll Make a Difference With Us** 




  





 We are seeking a resource to manage end user computing delivery from our external vendor. This role is based in our Enterprise IT department, which has team members located globally. The position requires an on-site presence in Sweden for direct involvement with projects and service delivery in our offices. The main responsibility is to ensure that deliveries for Telenor Sweden meet established standards.
 



  





**Are you the one we’re looking for?** 




  





 We need someone who’s always on their toes! You have a genuine desire to learn and develop so we can continue to meet our customers’ ever-changing needs – today and tomorrow.
 



  





 Skills that we hope that you have:
 


* Proven experience with SCCM, hardware asset management, application deployment, Windows OS, Microsoft Active Directory, Group Policy Objects (GPO), and IT compliance.
* Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Minimum 10 years of experience in a similar field or position, with a strong track record of problem-solving and effective communication.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
* Preferred skills include Microsoft Intune, Ivanti Application Control, MacOS support, and familiarity with vCenter.
* Excellent language skills in Swedish and English


- 


**What We Value Most:** 
 Above all, we believe in potential. Adaptability and a genuine willingness to learn are the qualities we prize most. If you're someone who embraces change and is eager to grow, you’ll fit right in
 



 We believe in potential, and what matters most is adaptability and a willingness to learn!
 



  





 For this position, Swedish citizenship is required.
 



  





**Apply today!** 




  





 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today. Last day to apply is 14th of October 2025.
 



  





 If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact the hiring manager Paul A. Teigland at paul.teigland@telenor.com. Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.
 



 Placement: Karlskrona or Stockholm, Solna office
 



  





**Our promise to you** 




  





**We are better together.** 




  





 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
 



  





**We support relationships and societies.** 




  





 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
 



  





**We make room for life.** 




  





 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two ‘give-me-a-break’ days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
 



  





**We invite you to a career in motion.** 




  





 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
 



  





**Good to know** 




  





 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Business Analyst, Supply Planning
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We are looking for a curious and self-driven Business Analyst to join our Supply Planning Unit. In this role, you will lead analytics initiatives and maintain and develop systems for all three Reverse Supply areas (External Exit and overstock selling, faulty items and garment collection). You’ll play a key part in the team in helping unwanted garments get a new life, and ensure the garments end up in the right place! As a proactive self-starter, you will take ownership of projects from hypothesis to insight and delivery, thrive on ambiguity, ask the right questions, and challenge the status quo. This position requires a blend of business acumen and analytical skills.
   

  

*Your key responsibilities include:*
* Lead analytics initiatives from hypothesis to delivery, turning data into actionable insights.
* Own and develop internal applications supporting overstock sales and partner management.
* Use SQL and Power BI to gather, clean, and visualize data.
* Develop and maintain web-based applications, hence exposure to C#, JavaScript, and PowerApps or similar languages and programs are required.
* Maintain and follow-up on sustainability KPIs for business development and public disclosure.
* Act as the go-to person for data and application-related questions and incidents
* Drive automation and data validation in areas with manual processes.
* Collaborate cross-functionally within Supply Planning and across H&M Group.


**Who You Are**
 Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a business-minded, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have a robust analytical ability, business acumen, self-drive with an eye for change and improvement opportunities.
   

  

*We are looking for people with*
* Minimum 3 years of experience in a data-driven role within supply chain operations, ideally in overstock handling, returns management, or circular fashion initiatives.
* Proven hands-on experience with SQL for querying large datasets, and Power BI for building dashboards and visualizing KPIs. Experience with Python or other programming language for automation, C# for application logic, and JavaScript for web-application development is needed.
* Experience with Power Automate for workflow optimization is a strong plus.
* Some experience from working with Cloud Platforms and maintaining web-based applications, especially in the context of internal business applications and data pipelines


*And people who are*
* Strong communicators and storytellers with the skills and ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various different stakeholders.
* Curious and take the initiative, driven to explore new ideas, ask questions, and take ownership from start to finish
* Based in Stockholm and able to commute to the office 4 days/week (no relocation support).


 This is a permanent position starting as soon as possible and you will report to Julia Lindberg, Reverse Supply Manager within Supply Planning.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your CV and English as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.
* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment. A day off on your birthday to relax and celebrate your special day. Special gift to celebrate the birth of your child, etc.)


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

  

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: IT-Säkerhetssamordnare
description:
**Uppdragsbeskrivning**
 I rollen IT-säkerhetssamordnare hos vår kund ger du stöd i säkerhetsarbete för de applikationer och system som finns i kundens IT-miljö. IT-säkerhetssamordnaren ansvarar för uppföljning av lagar, regler och interna styrdokument inom IT-säkerhet samt analyserar och rapporterar avvikelser. IT-säkerhetssamordnaren stödjer projekt och förvaltning med kravställning och beslutsunderlag avseende IT-säkerhetsfrågor samt agerar rådgivare avseende IT-säkerhet.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som IT-säkerhetssamordnare är du en central person i arbetet med att säkerställa och vidareutveckla en säker och stabil IT-miljö, en IT-miljö som är kritiskt för att elförsörjningen och i slutändan samhället skall fungera.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Koordinering av IT-säkerhetsarbete
* Stöd i IT-säkerhetsfrågor och sakkunnig inom IT-säkerhetsarkitektur och GRC
* Medverka i framtagande av IT-säkerhetskrav för system och IT-tjänster
* Stödja företrädesvis projekt med beslutsunderlag och vara föredragande i IT-säkerhetsfrågor
* Identifiera verksamhetens behov av säkerhetsnivå i IT-systemen
* Medverka i ”särskild säkerhetsbedömning” av system
* Genomföra periodiska analyser av IT- och informationssäkerheten, t.ex. risk-och sårbarhetsanalys
* Följa upp efterlevnad inom IT- och informationssäkerhet och rapportera avvikelser
* Definiera säkerhetskrav mot leverantörer av IT-tjänster till kunden.


**För att lyckas i rollen som** 
**IT-säkerhetssamordnare** 
**måste du ha:**
* Högskole/universitetsutbildning 120p/180hp med inriktning mot IT eller minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT.
* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av IT-säkerhetsarbete i medelstor(a) (50-249 anställda) till stor(a) organisation(er) (250 anställda och uppåt).
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från tillämpning av ramverk och standarder inom IT- och informationssäkerhet exempelvis ISO27001, Open Security Architecture, CIS Controls, NIST Cybersecurity eller annat väl etablerat ramverk inom IT-säkerhet.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från kravställning och uppföljning inom IT- och informationssäkerhetsområdet.


**Vi ser även gärna att du har:**
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av IT-säkerhetsarbete relaterat till nätverks- och serverinfrastruktur samt klienter
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från IT- och informationssäkerhet relaterat till OT-system (exempelvis ICS- och SCADA-system).
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från IT- och informationssäkerhet inom myndighet/offentlig sektor och/eller inom energibranschen.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ledning av medarbetare, exempelvis som teamledare, projektledare, förvaltningsledare.


**Vad får man ut av att vara en ten10are**
 Hos ten10 är det viktigt att finna en sund balans mellan privat- och arbetsliv. Vi arbetar därför alltid tillsammans för att finna vad som kan kan vara bra för din vardag. Vi erbjuder inte bara valmöjligheter hur du vill påverka din arbetsdag utan även i ersättningsmodeller. Vi erbjuder en av marknadens mest attraktiva lönemodeller och där du får kompensation för det värde du skapar.
   

  

 När du är en del av ten10 är det viktigt att du även känner det och kan dela med dig av dina erfarenheter, tankar och ideér. Detta kan du göra när vi alla ses gemensamt och umgås på AWs, utlandsresor, julbord eller när vi gör något annat kul ihop.
   

  

 Vi pratar inte bara om att vi faktiskt bryr oss om våra medarbetare utan hela vår verksamhet utgörs av våra medarbetare. Vår ambition är att skapa dem rätta förutsättningarna för just dig.

title: Senior IT-arkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt
* Minst 5 års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av att designa PKI och arbeta med kravställning kring PKI.
* Minst nivå 4 inom PKI (självgående och ledande inom sitt gebit)
* Relevant certifiering inom KPI, (CISSP eller liknande), alternativt flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom området som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig för rollen
* Uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska i syfte att kunna producera processer, rutiner och övrig dokumentatio


**Meriterande**
* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet inom it-infrastrukturtjänster
* Certifierad inom agila arbetsmetoder
* Minst 5 års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av Statliga myndigheter eller offentlig verksamhet
* Flerårig och aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av följande verktyg: Jira, Visio, Confluence och ServiceNow


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 30-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Data Analyst to Financial Crime Prevention area in SEB
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Financial Crime prevention, whether it is to combat fraud against our customers, protecting the bank from money laundering or perform sanction screening is central not only to SEB but for the society as such. If you are interested in working with our solutions regarding sanctions screening, continue reading!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 In this role you will work as data analyst in the FCP Screening team. We are maintaining and developing a bought system used for sanctions screening of SEB customers and transactions. You will support the team and stakeholders by analyzing data, create insights, and produce reports.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* Experience with Python, Tableau, SQL or other similar tools and technologies.
* It’s meriting if you have previous experience working with solutions within financial crime prevention, sanctions screening, payment or banking in general.
* You have an analytical mindset and an ability to solve complex technical problems.
* You enjoy working with new technologies, encourage and drive change and continuous improvement in teamwork, tools and processes.


**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Long-term stability
* Opportunities to help transform an industry
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Agile and modern ways of working


**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than
 **2025-10-31** 
 . If you have questions about the position please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Rasmus Hallberg, at rasmus.hallberg@seb.se.

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
**About HCLTech** 




 HCLTech is a global technology company, spread across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services
 



 We embed ESG imperatives into every aspect of our business and ensure that the progress we supercharge is responsible, inclusive and beneficial to all our stakeholders in the long term. We have committed to achieving net zero by 2040.
 



  





 To learn more about how we can supercharge progress for you, visit
 
 www.hcltech.com
 




 As a Solution Architect, you will be responsible for engaging with the business units of each division to work on pre-defined and ad-hoc programs.
 



 You will work alongside the Enterprise Architects to provide architecturally aligned, cost-efficient solutions for business units demands. Understand and translate business requirements into technical solutions.
 



**Responsibilities / Capabilities:** 




**Enterprise Architect** 



* Design, develop, and implement IT solutions that meet the needs of the business
* Proven expertise working with IT architectural frameworks and tools
* Skills and knowledge necessary to design, deploy, and manage Enterprise Solutions
* Work with the business to ensure that solutions are aligned with the company's strategic goals
* Collaborate with other architects and engineers to ensure that solutions are consistent with the company's architecture standards
* Stay up-to-date on the latest technologies and trends
* 10 years' experience working within the IT Management area advising business stakeholders in their transformation journey
* Be results-oriented and ensure both the group's and your own performance
* Be able to analyze information flows, see connections, patterns and draw boundaries
* Have good leadership qualities and the ability to see the whole picture and present information that is relevant in the context
* Have good cooperation skills, be helpful and have a good attitude and drive
* Have the ability and willingness to learn new things, be flexible and be able to adapt to changes
* Solid understanding of enterprise architecture principles and practices



  





 Experience with a variety of IT technologies and platforms

title: Data Analyst - SQL - SAS - Python
description:
Join our Battlefield Analytics team as a Senior Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of gaming! You'll drive key insights into the software and experiential quality of Battlefield, directly impacting player experiences.
 



  





 In this role, you'll leverage your analytics skills to guide strategic decisions, ensuring our leaders prioritize data-driven choices for product optimization, gameplay features, technology advancements, testing processes, and overall game quality. Reporting to the Analytics Director, you'll be an integral part of our innovative analytics organization, making a tangible impact in the gaming world.
 



  





**This is a hybrid model role. You will be required to work in our Srockholm office 3 days per week.** 




  





**The Role:** 




 As a Senior Data Analyst, you will develop business intelligence products and lead data projects to enhance data maturity for our Development and Quality Assurance teams. Your expertise in SQL, ETL pipelines, and data visualization will be crucial in analysing data and identifying trends to drive decision-making across the organization.
 



  





 · Report to the Senior Analytics Manager.
 



  





 · Influence the data analytics roadmap for major EA titles.
 



  





 · Develop data products to improve decision-making.
 



  





 · Establish best practices in data analytics and visualization.
 



  





 · Influencing data governance practices to enhance data maturity.
 



  





 · Provide coaching to Data Analyst colleagues.
 



  





  





**Skills Required** 




  





 · 3+ years of professional analytical experience.
 



  





 · Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
 



  





 · Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
 



  





 · Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
 



  





 · Able to foster working relationships with partners.
 



  





  





**Benefits:** 




 We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, pension with company match, and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes outstanding people to make outstanding games, we offer a culture that's motivated by creativity and individuality.

title: Junior Analysts to M&A Transaction Services (Stockholm & Malmö) - Aug 2026
description:
Deloitte is a global leader in Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal and Consultative Services. With more than 450,000 employees in over 150 countries, we help our clients and our communities solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals through domain and industry expertise, global reach and alliances with the largest tech providers. What defines Deloitte is our drive to make a meaningful difference. For us, this means long-term development and results for our clients and their companies, ideas and actions that also contribute to positive societal development. It is also about empowering our people and promoting their development.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 In M&A Transaction Services we support our clients in connection to acquisition or sale of companies by providing insightful financial analysis. Our work involves reviewing historical trading and balance sheets, assessing forecast consistency, and evaluating operational and financial assets and liabilities to help clients make well-informed decisions. Our clients include both domestic and international private equity firms and strategic corporates.
   

  

  





 As an Analyst in our M&A Transaction Services team, you will contribute by analysing financial data, preparing agendas for management interviews, and drafting due diligence reports. We highly value teamwork and collaboration, and you will work closely with experienced colleagues who will support your growth and development. Throughout your work, you are expected to demonstrate professionalism, integrity and a strong work ethic. This role offers a unique opportunity to build expertise in managing due diligence processes for both buyers and sellers of companies.
   

  

  





 We welcome applications from candidates with a master’s degree who are eager to join our team in Stockholm or Malmö in August 2026.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

 We are looking for individuals who:
   

  

  




* Have a graduate degree (MBA/Master’s or equivalent) with strong academic results


* Are interested in financial analysis and motivated to understand business dynamics


* Enjoy working collaboratively and are motivated to learn and grow in a supportive environment


* Communicate effectively in English and preferably a Scandinavian language


* Are proficient in MS Excel and PowerPoint


* Approach challenges with a positive and flexible mindset, managing deadlines constructively


**Additional Information**

**What we offer**




 As a part of Deloitte you get access to the world’s largest consultancy network, meaning you have colleagues all over the globe who you can utilize in order to develop yourself, our clients and our business. You will work with exciting and complex projects both on a global and Nordic level within a team who values your perspective. Your personal development and the opportunities that help you grow is of great importance to us. We offer you practical experience, a personal coach as well as continuous feedback and input from more experienced colleagues.
   

  

  





 You get the opportunity to be part of an organization where we help our clients on their journey to become a more sustainable organization. You also get to be involved in our own initiatives regarding climate and environmental work as well as social responsibility.
   

  

  





**How to apply**




 Submit your application online as soon as possible. Your application should contain your:
   

  

  




* CV


* University grades. The grade document you upload should have been retrieved no more than 2 months ago


 In the first step, you upload your CV. In the next step, you upload your university transcripts (for courses completed so far) and answer questions related to the role, including a motivation for why you have applied for this role. Please note that you need to submit all the requested documents for your application to be considered completed. Apply as soon as possible as we review applications on an ongoing basis. Upon submitting your application, you should receive a confirmation email from us. If you don't receive this email, we advise you to submit your application again. If you are applying for multiple positions with us, please clarify in your applications which role you are most interested in.
   

  

  


**Questions**




 If you have any questions regarding the application process, please contact Sophie Karlerö Kolijn, Recruiter, at skarlero@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, in order to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/. For the roles where university grades are requested a verification of the grades is made as a part of the recruitment process. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Head of Cyber Threat Intelligence
description:
Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Head of Cyber Threat Intelligence to team up with the most dedicated team of cybersecurity specialists at Truesec.
   

  

**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breaches and minimizing their impact. Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally.
   

  

 Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover. Today, we employ around 350 employees, and as cybercrime grows, so do we. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Head of Cyber Threat Intelligence who wants to make a difference together with us at Truesec.
   

  

**About Truesec Cyber Threat Intelligence Team**
 Our Cyber Threat Intelligence team is a critical part of Truesec’s mission to protect organizations from cyber threats. It provides the foundation for proactive cybersecurity strategies, enabling us to anticipate and respond to emerging threats effectively.
   

  

 The Cyber Threat Intelligence team works closely with our Incident Response (IR) and Security Operations Center (SOC) teams to ensure timely and actionable intelligence, maximizing our ability to detect and disarm cyber adversaries. By analyzing threat trends, actor behavior, and technical indicators, the domain plays a vital role in safeguarding our customers and driving resilience across industries.
   

  

 As a leader of this domain, you will have access to unique threat data derived from one of Europe’s leading IR teams and monitoring operations across Northern Europe. Your work will directly contribute to shaping how organizations defend against cybercrime.
   

  

**The Role**
 As the Head of Cyber Threat Intelligence, you will lead, innovate, and grow our CTI department. You will oversee strategic initiatives, operational excellence, and collaboration across the organization to ensure we remain a leader in cybersecurity.
   

  

*Your responsibilities will include:*
* Building and leading the team: Shape, coach, and inspire team members to achieve ambitious goals.
* Truesec CSIRT (CERT) responsibilities: Maintain relationships with FIRST, TF-CSIRT, cert.se, NCSE, and other organizations while ensuring certifications and active contributions to the CERT community.
* Operational specialist work: Conduct advanced threat analyses, create insightful reports, and present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Entrepreneurship & commercial development: Develop new CTI offerings, package services, set pricing, and drive proactive business opportunities.
* Collaborate with IR & SOC teams: Provide actionable Threat Intelligence and innovate ways to utilize threat information for improved resilience.
* Represent the company: Serve as Truesec’s spokesperson in the CTI domain, delivering presentations, engaging with authorities, and sharing insights.


**Your Potential Background**
 You are an experienced cybersecurity professional who thrives in dynamic and fast-paced environments. You have a deep understanding of Cyber Threat Intelligence and are passionate about building teams, solving complex problems, and making an impact. As a leader, you inspire trust, bring out the best in people, and know how to navigate both technical and business landscapes.
   

  

 You are motivated by driving innovation and staying ahead of the curve in the ever-evolving cybersecurity domain. You are a curious learner, actively tracking new threats, methods, and trends, and you’re ready to take on one of the most strategic roles in Truesec.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Extensive experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence, including analysis methods, sources, and tools.
* Proven leadership skills, with a track record of building or expanding high-performing teams.
* Strong business acumen, with the ability to present, sell, and price services effectively.
* Fluency in Swedish and English (spoken and written).
* A passion for cybersecurity, with a proactive approach to staying updated on emerging threats and techniques.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of engaging with technical teams, customers, and external stakeholders.


**Bonus Skills**
* Hands-on experience working in the CERT community, including participation in organizations like FIRST and TF-CSIRT.
* Certifications such as CREST Certified Threat Intelligence Manager, GIAC Cyber Threat Intelligence, CISSP, or similar.
* Experience collaborating with government authorities and cybersecurity regulators.
* Familiarity with advanced threat actor profiling and intelligence sharing frameworks.


***Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.***
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news.
   

  

 This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company – and learn from some of the best in the field.
   

  

 Are you ready to team up with the most dedicated experts and lead the charge in securing Europe’s digital landscape?
   

  

 We are excited to get to know you!

title: Regional Sales Manager - Nordics
description:
**Description**
 Silverfort is a cyber-security startup that develops a revolutionary identity protection platform. Our mission is to provide industry-leading unified identity protection solutions for hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Using patented technology, Silverfort’s platform enables strong authentication across entire corporate networks and cloud environments, without any modifications to endpoints and servers.
   

  

 Silverfort has been widely recognized as an industry innovator, being named “Best of MFA award” from Expert Insights, Microsoft Security 20/20 partner award, Homeland Security Award for Best Identity Access Management platform for its agentless secure authentication and zero trust platform by Astors.
   

  

 We are looking for a hungry, hunter-at-heart, Regional Sales Manager superstar to join our rapidly growing company and help boost our client-base across the Nordics Region.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Execute on the entire sales cycle end-to-end: create and qualify leads and pipeline, manage high-quality C-level customer meetings, oversee POCs, perform key account management, negotiate and close
* Establish and maintain direct relationships with C-level executives in target end-customer accounts as well as in key channel partners
* Develop and execute comprehensive business plans for strategic accounts, become a trusted advisor for prospects, evangelize value propositions on an expert-level
* Capture, reflect and maintain sales forecast diligently in SFDC
* Collaborate with presale, product, marketing and customer success teams to maximize overall customer satisfaction
* Meet/exceed sales quota


**Requirements**
* 6+ years of B2B sales experience overall, out of which 3+ years in direct sales of cybersecurity or IAM software solutions to medium and large enterprises
* Proven track record of consistently meeting/overachieving sales quotas
* Experience in working closely and collaboratively with channel partners
* Pro-active, hungry, self-driven individual, with a whatever-it-takes attitude
* Passionate about innovative technology and about winning customers’ hearts and minds
* Outstanding communication skills, comfortable presenting to C-level executives and technical leads alike
* Experience in selling technical products of startup-stage vendors- a significant advantage

title: Specialist Dataskydd & Informationssäkerhet
description:
Jobba för originalet.
   

  

 Välkommen till Apoteket, nummer ett sedan 1971. Med visioner för framtiden och kvalitet i varje detalj, skapar vi förutsättningar för ett liv i hälsa. Hos oss utvecklas du i en kultur där din röst alltid blir hörd. Och allt vi får över ger vi tillbaka till samhället. Det är så vi gör skillnad på riktigt.
   

  

 Om Juridik, Säkerhet & Beredskap
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar du i en enhet som spelar en avgörande roll för Apotekets trygghet och stabilitet. Vi ansvarar för styrning och rådgivning inom flera viktiga områden: bolagsstyrning, affärsjuridik, dataskydd, informationssäkerhet, fysisk säkerhet, kris- och kontinuitetsplanering samt beredskapsfrågor.
   

  

 Vi är sju specialister med kompletterande kompetenser som tillsammans stödjer hela verksamheten utifrån affärsbehov och risker. Här möts du av en kultur där samarbete, utveckling och nyfikenhet står i centrum – och där du får möjlighet att bidra till frågor som är både högaktuella och avgörande för Apotekets framtid.
   

  

 Din roll
   

  

 I rollen som Specialist Dataskydd & Informationssäkerhet blir du en nyckelperson i att stötta verksamheten med rådgivning, riskanalyser och utbildningar. Du arbetar nära både Apotekets dataskyddsombud och informationssäkerhetssamordnaren och har kontaktytor i hela organisationen. Rollen är operativ och tvärfunktionell, där du får möjlighet att själv sätta din prägel och bidra till utvecklingen av Apotekets arbetssätt och ramverk.
   

  

 Vad du kommer göra hos oss:
   

  

* Vägleda verksamheten i frågor om dataskydd och informationssäkerhet.
* Stötta i dataskyddsbedömningar (DPIA) och underhålla registerförteckning.
* Följa upp och kontrollera regelefterlevnad, inklusive hantering av personuppgiftsincidenter.
* Bidra till att utveckla och förvalta Apotekets styrmodell för informationssäkerhet.
* Vägleda i utformning och utvärdering av säkerhetsåtgärder.
* Utveckla utbildningsmaterial och hålla utbildningar inom dataskydd och cybersäkerhet.
* Stötta verksamheten vid riskanalyser, informationsanalyser och klassningar.
* Underhålla interna informationskanaler som intranät samt förvalta obligatoriska utbildningar.


**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som har några års erfarenhet inom dataskydd och/eller informationssäkerhet, gärna i en kombinerad roll. Du har förmågan att tolka lagtext och direktiv, omsätta dem i praktiska lösningar och göra komplexa frågor begripliga för olika målgrupper. Du har också ett tekniskt intresse och vill använda din förståelse för IT till att förbättra processer och öka säkerheten.
   

  

* Du har en relevant akademisk examen, exempelvis inom juridik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande utbildning.
* Du har erfarenhet av dataskyddsfrågor (GDPR) och informationssäkerhet.
* Du har ett analytiskt och nyfiket förhållningssätt samt intresse för hur teknik kan förbättra processer.
* Du har erfarenhet av riskbedömningar, incidenthantering och utbildningsinsatser.
* Du har förmåga att arbeta rådgivande, kravställande och operativt nära verksamheten.
* Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder...**
* Friskvårdsbidrag: 5000 kr per år.
* Personalrabatt: Förmånliga priser på många av våra produkter.
* Flexibla helgdagar: Möjlighet att byta arbetsfria helgdagar mot andra dagar på året.
* Förmånsportal (Benify): Erbjudanden inom bland annat kollektivtrafik, leasingbil, gym och hälsobehandlingar.
* Trygga försäkringar: Förstärkt föräldrapenning, tjänstepension (ITP) och kompletterande försäkringar.


**Om oss**
 Apoteket grundades 1971 och ägs av svenska staten, vilket innebär att vi arbetar både ansvarsfullt och långsiktigt. Vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag handlar om att förbättra människors hälsa, läkemedelsanvändning och bidra till ökad patientsäkerhet. Med omkring 400 apotek och 3000 medarbetare över hela landet har vi nära samarbete med hälso- och sjukvården – alltid med omtanke om både människor och miljö.
   

  

 Vårt mål är tydligt: Ett liv i hälsa, för alla.
   

  

  

**Praktisk information:**
 Nyfiken? Det räcker gott.
   

  

 Hör av dig om rollen fångar ditt intresse! Vi berättar gärna mer om tjänsten och vår verksamhet – så du får en tydligare bild och kan avgöra om det känns helt rätt. Vänta bara inte för länge, urval och intervju sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Skicka ditt CV tillsammans med svar på våra urvalsfrågor. Du behöver inte skriva ett personligt brev – frågorna är utformade för att hjälpa oss förstå mer om dina erfarenheter och kompetenser för matchning mot tjänst.
   

  

 Vi använder tester för objektivt urval som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess. Provanställning tillämpas.
   

  

 Välkommen till Apoteket!

title: Junior Analysts to M&A Deal Advisory - Aug 2026
description:
Deloitte is a global leader in Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal and Consultative Services. With more than 450,000 employees in over 150 countries, we help our clients and our communities solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals through domain and industry expertise, global reach and alliances with the largest tech providers. What defines Deloitte is our drive to make a meaningful difference. For us, this means long-term development and results for our clients and their companies, ideas and actions that also contribute to positive societal development. It is also about empowering our people and promoting their development.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 At Deloitte Deal Advisory, we help clients maximise the value of their mergers, acquisitions and divestitures across the entire transaction cycle, including the below offerings:
   

  

  




* M&A Strategy


* Due diligence services, including:


* Commercial due diligence


* Operational due diligence


* IT/Tech due diligence


* Carve-out and integration planning and execution


* Value Creation Services


 Our team combines expertise from strategy, finance, operations and technology to provide tailored, high-quality insights that inform investment and divestiture decisions, as well as post-deal value creation. Operating across the Nordics and in close collaboration with offices across the globe, we work seamlessly to deliver comprehensive solutions during critical phases of the deal lifecycle.
   

  

  


 We are seeking Analysts to join our Stockholm office in August 2026. In this role, you will support clients through integration and separation programmes, manage various aspects of the M&A process and engage with stakeholders to optimise deal value. You will conduct high-quality research and analysis, contributing to the delivery of strategic insights. Additionally, you will develop rapport and trust with clients, drive programme management, prepare presentations, facilitate workshops and contribute to business development activities that enhance Deloitte’s market presence across the region.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

 A successful candidate has the following qualities:
   

  

  




* Completed MBA or Master’s degree with strong academic results


* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills


* Prior experience in strategy development or any part of the M&A lifecycle is beneficial, e.g., through management consulting or other internships


* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team


* Flexibility in handling the demands of deal cycles


* Proficiency in MS PowerPoint and Excel


* Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably Swedish or another Scandinavian language


* Can-do attitude, goal-oriented and positive mindset


**How you’ll grow**

 As an Analyst with Deloitte Deal Advisory, you will be an integral part of a dynamic and growing team, contributing to successful mergers and divestitures across a range of industries. You will experience a steep learning curve in management advisory, strategic thinking and change management, with broad exposure to M&A projects in various industries and geographies. Working closely with colleagues, clients and investors worldwide, you will gain valuable international experience.
   

  

  





 We are expanding our Deal Advisory practice in Sweden, offering you the opportunity to play a key role in our growth across the Nordics. You will have the freedom to take on responsibility and grow in both client-facing and internal situations, with our full support to help you advance your career. We value honesty and direct communication and foster an inclusive team culture where contributions are recognised.
   

  

  




**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 As a part of Deloitte, you will gain access to the world’s largest consultancy network, meaning you will have colleagues all over the globe who you can utilise in order to develop yourself, our clients and our business. You will work with exciting and complex projects both on a global and Nordic level within a team that values your perspective. Your personal development and the opportunities that help you grow are of great importance to us. We offer you practical experience, a personal coach and a structured training programme that promotes continuous learning, as well as continuous feedback and guidance from more experienced colleagues.
   

  

  





 You will get the opportunity to be part of an organisation where we help our clients on their journey to become a more sustainable organisation. You also get to be involved in our own initiatives relating to climate and environmental work as well as social responsibility.
   

  

  





**How to apply** 
  

  

  





 Submit your application online as soon as possible. Your application should contain your:
   

  

  




* CV


* Cover letter


* University grades - the grade document you upload should have been retrieved no more than 2 months ago


 In the first step, you upload your CV. In the next step, you upload your university transcripts (for courses completed so far) and cover letter. Please note that you need to submit all the requested documents for your application to be considered completed. Apply as soon as possible as we review applications on an ongoing basis. Upon submitting your application, you should receive a confirmation email from us. If you don't receive this email, we advise you to submit your application again. If you are applying for multiple positions with us, please clarify in your applications which role you are most interested in.
   

  

  


**Questions**




 If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Sophie Karlerö Kolijn, Recruiter, at skarlero@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, in order to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/. For the roles where university grades are requested a verification of the grades is made as a part of the recruitment process. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Business Expert - Emerging Technology
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Business Expert within our
 **Emerging Tech** 
 function, you’ll play a key role in bridging business and technology. You’ll work closely with product managers, engineers, designers, and stakeholders to ensure our products deliver real value to customers and the business. You’ll be involved in ideation, development, and change management, helping drive innovation across H&M.
   

  

 We are currently hiring for
 **two Business Expert roles** 
 , each embedded in a different product team with distinct focus areas:
   

  

***Role Track 1: Smart Store & Retail Operations***
**Team Focus:** 
 Store digitalization, customer-facing retail tech, and in-store experience.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Drive digital transformation in stores through mobile apps, POS systems, and smart store solutions.
* Collaborate with store teams to gather requirements and ensure successful adoption.
* Analyze user feedback and app usage data to guide product improvements.
* Lead change management and training initiatives for store staff.


**Preferred Experience:**
* Deep understanding of retail operations and workflows.
* Experience with smart store concepts and digital retail tools.
* Agile mindset and familiarity with product development processes.


***Role Track 2: Inventory, Supply Chain & Merchandising***
**Team Focus:** 
 Internal operations, supply chain optimization, and merchandising processes.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Provide business expertise during ideation and development of new tech solutions.
* Investigate and redesign business processes across supply chain and merchandising.
* Act as a strategic partner to product managers, supporting prioritization and rollout.
* Collaborate across functions to ensure solutions meet business needs.


**Preferred Experience:**
* Strong knowledge of supply chain flows, merchandising, or store operations.
* Experience working within H&M or similar retail environments.
* Ability to connect business and tech perspectives to solve complex problems.


**Who You'll Work With**
 Emerging Tech is at the forefront of strategic disruption on processes and tech, exploring and implementing cutting-edge technologies to shape the future of fashion retail. Our team bridges the gap between business and technology, leveraging AI, immersive experiences, automation, and new digital capabilities to enhance customer experiences, optimise operations, and drive sustainable growth. We thrive on experimentation, collaboration, and rapid iteration to unlock new opportunities and create seamless, forward-thinking solutions for the H&M brand.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people that have*
* Retail operations & process knowledge – deep understanding of in-store operations, workflows, and challenges to ensure the app meets business and user needs.
* Experience in requirement gathering & stakeholder management – ability to collect and translate business requirements into clear specifications for development teams.
* Change management & user adoption experience in driving change, training store staff, and ensuring successful adoption of new digital tools.
* Be a natural point of contact, working to create understanding regarding the product purpose and plan, both within a product/between products and outside the product.


*And people who are:*
* Strategic thinker with a passion for innovation and technology.
* Skilled in stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration.
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and driving change.
* Curious, data-driven, and eager to make an impact.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make. We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound.
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial environment where your insights directly influence strategic decisions.
* A collaborative culture that values innovation, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Infrastructure Lead
description:
Arbetsförmedlingen söker nu en erfaren och kompetent ledare inom Datacenter och Nätverk. Hos oss kallas rollen Byggstensansvarig, vilket betyder att du har helhetsansvaret för en definierad del av vår IT-infrastruktur. I detta fall är byggstenen
 **Datacenter och Nätverk** 
 och utgör en av de mest centrala grunderna i vår verksamhet.
 



  





 Som Byggstensansvarig ansvarar du för både utveckling och förvaltning av våra datacenter, nätverk och tillhörande hårdvara. Din uppgift blir att säkerställa en modern, säker och driftsäker miljö som möter organisationens behov idag och i framtiden.
 



  





 I din roll kommer du bland annat att:
 


* Ansvara för leveransen inom datacenter och nätverk – inklusive drift, utveckling och livscykelhantering
* Ta fram vision, målbild och strategi för området
* Säkerställa att datacenter- och nätverksmiljön följer organisationens övergripande strategier, styrande dokument samt lagar och förordningar
* Identifiera utmaningar och driva förbättringsarbete, i nära samarbete med angränsande team och verksamhetsområden
* Hantera incidenter, inklusive beslutsfattande om åtgärder och eventuell eskalering
* Följa upp nyttor och användarupplevelse inom området
* Ansvara för säkerhet, kontinuitetsplanering och efterlevnad
* Hantera interna och externa revisioner kopplade till datacenter och nätverk



  





**För att passa i rollen behöver du vara:** 




 En
 **drivande person** 
 med starkt självledarskap som både tar egna initiativ och leder teamen framåt mot gemensamma mål. Du är
 **kommunikativ** 
 och fungerar som en viktig länk mellan teamen och olika intressenter, vilket skapar tydlighet och samordning i arbetet. Du är
 **flexibel** 
 och van att skifta fokus och prioritera om i en föränderlig och snabb miljö. Med din
 **sociala kompetens** 
 arbetar du både team- och serviceinriktat och bidrar till ett
 **positivt, transparent och inkluderande samarbetsklimat** 
 . Du har också förmågan att se till
 **det stora perspektivet** 
 och förstå hur olika delar hänger ihop i helheten.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsorten är Solna.
 



 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Hos oss ingår även friskvård under arbetstid och ett förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag.
 



 Som anställd på Arbetsförmedlingen har du också tillgång till kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter inom myndigheten. Genom vårt arbete bidrar vi till ett inkluderande och hållbart samhälle, där du får möjlighet att göra en verklig skillnad för individer och för samhället i stort.
 




 Mer om att jobba hos oss
 




  





**Grundläggande krav för tjänsten** 



* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* Flera års aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av arbete inom området Datacenter och Nätverk
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att dokumentera och skriva användarinstruktioner
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva och ta fram strategier för området.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av leveransuppföljning



  





**Övriga meriter för tjänsten** 



* Erfarenhet av att driva förändringsledning
* Teknisk erfarenhet av plattformar och produkter inom datacenter och nätverk, till exempel Cisco ACI, F5 och Infoblox
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder eller likvärdigt arbetssätt



  





 Den statliga värdegrunden guidar oss i vårt dagliga arbete. Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet.
 




 Mer om statliga värdegrunden
 




  





 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap:
 



  





 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
 


* **Tar ansvar** 
 för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* **Anpassar sig** 
 till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* **Tar initiativ** 
 till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring



  





**Ansökan** 




 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-10-13.
 



 Bifoga ditt CV där du specificerar årtal, månad och arbetsuppgifter för varje anställning, samt intyg som styrker kraven om utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet i din ansökan.
 



  





 Det är viktigt att du besvarar urvalsfrågorna detaljerat och sanningsenligt, för att vi ska få en tydlig bild av din erfarenhet. Om efterfrågad information inte framgår riskerar du bli bortsållad i urvalet.
 



  





 Du behöver inte skicka in ett personligt brev. Under rekryteringsprocessen kan urvalstester förekomma. Vi kommer att hålla dig informerad genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.
 
 Mer om vår rekryteringsprocess.

title: External Affairs and Communication Manager
company_industry: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.
   

  

 The Position
   

  

 Would you like to help achieve a healthier Sweden by helping to bring innovative and impactful healthcare technologies into the healthcare system? Do you have knowledge and experience of driving insightful and impactful communication with decision makers at all levels in Swedish healthcare? Do you have the ambition to influence, to work cross functionally and collaboratively and support the uptake of High Medical Value Solutions that help improve medical decisions and patient journeys? Then this position could be of interest for you!
   

  

****External Affairs and Communications Manager****
 We are now looking for an
 **External Affairs and Communications Manager** 
 to join our Commercial Customer Excellence team. The position is focused on enabling win-win situations and a long-term sustainable business by driving meaningful external and internal engagement between Roche and stakeholders in the healthcare system, with special emphasis on Roche Diagnostics' portfolio of especially innovative tests, systems and digital solutions that enable better decisions by clinicians and patients (learn more about our solutions here).
   

  

 As an
 **External Affairs and Communications Manager** 
 at Roche Diagnostics, you have the ability to influence your own development and you get the opportunity to formulate strong external communications strategies for driving positive and impactful brand recognition, healthcare system stakeholder perception and employer reputation for Roche.
   

  

 The
 **External Affairs and Communications Manager** 
 main purpose is to create better health outcomes by:
   

  

* Enabling long-term sustainable business by driving external and internal engagements with Roche that lead to triple-win solutions for patients, healthcare system and Roche
* Maintaining and developing the experience and reputation of Roche as a reliable, trusted advisor among key stakeholders in the Swedish healthcare system
* Developing and executing impactful market access plans for prioritized Roche products and solutions, with focus on high medical value solutions
* Enable strong collaboration and act as partner for collaboration between our local, regional and global organisational levels, and between Roche Pharma and Roche Diagnostics in Sweden, to enable efficiencies and increased impact in communications and external stakeholder engagements
* Provide leadership in company media relations, crisis management and preparedness - connecting local and global reputation strategies
* Manage crisis/ PR/communication agencies and other subcontractors to deliver results and meet objectives.
* Organise external meetings and Roche participation in external events and forums for dialogue with policymakers, industry associations and healthcare administrations
* Organise internal communication trainings and manage internal communication activities including local town hall events and oversight of intranet postings


**Who You Are**
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, expressing ideas fluently and eloquently, communicating with impact and influence
* Excellent networking and stakeholder management capability, internal and external
* Committed to, and skilled in, cross-functional collaboration and breaking down silos to achieve the best results for the organization
* Capable of identifying business opportunities beyond the product and generating insights
* System thinking abilities and ability to anticipate and adapt to volatile, rapid changing market and societal conditions enabling a sustainable business, both short and long term
* Mindset:
+ Working according to the Roche Diagnostics Sweden culture of collaborative, inclusive, respectful, curious, kind and with a high sense of accountability and ambition to create the most impact for patients, our customers and Roche
+ Interest in promoting innovation and digital solutions
+ Entrepreneurial thinking and acting in a competitive market environment
+ Flexible, pragmatic, resilient and with strong social skills, with ability to inspire and influence others


**Qualifications And Requirements**
* University degree in relevant fields, preferable Masters Degree or higher
* At least 5 years of experience in the Life Science industry
* Proficient in Swedish and English
* Excellent understanding of the Swedish healthcare system and medical practice
* Expertise in developing a compelling communication and company aspiration
* Strong business acumen and analytical skills
* Experience in execution of communications strategies with an impact on reputation
* Experience from issue and crisis management
* In this role, it is required to know, adhere to and actively contribute to, the development of current legal, technical and organizational requirements for information security


 Who we are
   

  

 A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.
   

  

 Let’s build a healthier future, together.
   

  

**Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

title: Senior Machine Learning Specialist
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Utveckla och förbättra SDK samt verktyg som stödjer olika moment inom ML.
* Samverka med ML-ingenjörer, forskare och produktteam för att ta fram skalbara plattformsfunktioner som levereras enligt plan.
* Driva projekt både självständigt och tillsammans med andra, ofta med inslag av nya teknologier utanför befintlig erfarenhet.
* Ansvara för drift och förvaltning av omfattande produktionskluster i Kubernetes, inklusive infrastruktur och DevOps-relaterade uppgifter.
* Utforma, dokumentera och införa lösningar för ML-infrastruktur med fokus på driftsäkerhet, testbarhet och enkel förvaltning.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Du har minst tre års erfarenhet av att driftsätta ML-modeller, både självständigt och i samarbete med andra.
* Du har goda kunskaper i deep learning, algoritmer och vanliga open source-ramverk som Hugging Face, Ray, PyTorch eller TensorFlow.
* Du har övergripande förståelse för databehandling kopplad till ML.
* Du är van vid agila arbetssätt samt att strukturera kod modulärt enligt etablerade standarder.
* Du har praktisk erfarenhet av att bygga och förvalta ML-system i produktion med Python, Scala eller liknande språk.


**Meriterande**
* Du har förståelse för distribuerad träning med GPU:er och Kubernetes.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 03-10-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Chief Architecture and Technology
description:
**Chief Architecture and Technology** 




 Are you an experienced enterprise architect and an inspiring leader who shares our passion for animals? Agria Djurförsäkring is looking for someone to drive our digital transformation toward a vision where Agria strengthens its position with new technology, creating Europe’s leading and most sustainable pet insurance company. Join our dedicated team and make a difference for animals and people!
 



  





  





**About the role** 




 As Chief Architecture and Technology, you will play a key role at Agria. You will be part of the Development Management team and report directly to our BIO. You will lead and develop the Architecture and Technology team, a group of about 10 cross-functional architects tasked with transforming, modernizing, and operationalizing Agria’s enterprise architecture, technology strategy, and governance through clear technology leadership. You will help drive the transition toward a more data-driven Agria and explore the opportunities to transform our business with AI.
 



  





 Your responsibilities will include:
 



  




* Defining goals, frameworks, and guidelines for our technology transformation and our vision of a future-proof IT landscape that will enable us to excel the customer and employee experience and drive efficiency.
* Align architectural target states and roadmaps with business strategy and set roadmaps taking us toward value-driven deliveries.
* Ensuring that our architecture complies with current policies, regulations, security requirements, and contracts while enabling high level of stability and availability.
* Ensuring that Agria’s architectural vision, target state and transformation plan are understood and applied at all levels through education, communication, and coaching.
* Establishing necessary processes, tools, and methods for effective architectural work and the realization of our transformation.
* Contributing to the strategic planning of our digital transformation and fostering an understanding of technology’s potential at the intersection of IT and business.
* Enabling proactive decision-making and business-driven prioritization in our digital transformation to support our European expansion.
* Contributing to sound and purpose-driven architectural governance across the Länsförsäkringar Group, ensuring Agria’s interests in shared IT capabilities are met through participation in central forums.



  





  





**Who are you?** 




 The following will make you successful in this role:
 


* A university degree in computer science, information systems, IT, or a related field.
