title: Head of Data Excellence & AI Transformation
description:
*Vill du leda en av de mest spännande resorna inom data och AI i Sverige just nu? Vi står inför en omfattande transformation där data, informationsstyrning och AI blir avgörande för vår framtid. Som Gruppchef för Transformation, Informationsstyrning och AI blir du en nyckelspelare i att bygga vårt center of excellence, forma riktlinjer och möjliggöra innovativa AI-lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för både kunder och medarbetare.*
**Om jobbet**
 I den här rollen får du ett helhetsansvar för att leda och utveckla Länsförsäkringsgruppens arbete inom transformation, informationsstyrning och AI. Du blir en motor i vår federations resa mot att fullt ut ta tillvara på de nya möjligheterna som data och AI skapar. Vidare ingår personalansvar för en, initialt, mindre grupp av experter, men då området är i en tillväxtfas ingår det också i ditt ansvar att fortsätta bygga upp teamet.
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag omfattar bland annat:
   

  

* Att driva transformation och utveckla enhetliga arbetssätt för informationsstyrning och AI
* Säkerställa att policies, riktlinjer och ramverk implementeras och följs, så att vi uppnår hög regelefterlevnad (GDPR, AI Act m.fl.)
* Leda arbetet med att etablera AI-lösningar i verksamheten och säkerställa att de bidrar till både affärsnytta och kundupplevelse
* Vara en brygga mellan affärsbehov och tekniska lösningar, och säkerställa att data och AI används för att skapa värde i hela organisationen
* Bygga ett starkt kontaktnät internt – från affärsenheter och IT till våra Länsbolag – för att driva gemensamma initiativ framåt


 Du rapporterar till Avdelningschef för Data och AI och leder ett område som är centralt i vår nya satsning.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Omfattande erfarenhet av att leda större transformationer, gärna inom data och AI
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av ledarskap inom IT/Tech med personalansvar
* Erfarenhet av att driva förändring och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt inom större, komplexa organisationer
* Kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av data governance, inklusive implementering av policies och riktlinjer
* God förståelse för AI och gedigen erfarenhet av att leda implementation, förvaltning, och uppföljning av AI-lösningar, inklusive AI-governance (riskhantering, etik, transparens)
* Förmåga att koppla samman affärsbehov med tekniska lösningar


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av regelverk som GDPR och AI Act, samt arbete inom bank eller försäkring.
   

  

 Som ledare är du:
   

  

* Inspirerande: Du kommunicerar en tydlig vision och skapar engagemang kring data & AI
* Samarbetsdriven: Du ser helheten och bygger broar mellan olika delar av organisationen
* Pådrivande: Du röjer hinder, skapar förutsättningar och tar ansvar för helhetsleveransen
* Noggrann: Du säkerställer att våra arbetssätt förankras och blir till hållbara riktlinjer


**Om oss**
 Vi står mitt i en kraftfull satsning på data och AI – en satsning som kommer att forma både vår organisation och vår bransch under lång tid framöver.
   

  

 Vi bygger ett center of excellence som:
   

  

* Utvecklar gemensamma plattformar och riktlinjer för hela Länsförsäkringsgruppen
* Accelererar use cases och säkerställer återanvändbarhet
* Stärker både lokal innovation och gemensamt lärande
* Ökar kunskap och kompetensbredd inom hela organisationen


 Hos oss blir du en del av en framtid där AI och data skapar nya möjligheter till proaktiva kundmöten och sömlösa helhetslösningar. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där du kan växa, utvecklas och vara med och bygga framtiden – på riktigt.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-15**

title: Director, Strategic Engagements – EMEA North
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Director, Strategic Engagements – EMEA North**
*Reporting to the GVP, EMEA North*
 The
 **Director of Strategic Engagements** 
 plays a pivotal role in designing and executing the
 **EMEA North Customer Engagement Program** 
 . As a key member of the GVP’s office, you will lead the orchestration of high-impact executive engagements, ensuring every interaction with our top 50 enterprise customers is strategic, insightful, and flawlessly executed.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities:****
* Executive Engagement Leadership: Drive and manage all executive-level engagements across the top 50 enterprise accounts in EMEA North, including meetings with CEOs, CIOs, CDOs, and other C-suite stakeholders.
* Governance Cadence: Establish and maintain a structured cadence of executive governance for strategic customers, ensuring consistent and value-driven interactions.
* Meeting Preparation & Delivery: Own the end-to-end process for C-suite meetings—developing agendas, crafting business propositions, conducting customer business analysis, creating content, and driving execution of outcomes.
* Customer Intimacy & Strategic Partnership: Deepen relationships with key C-suite personas, positioning ServiceNow as a strategic partner and contributing to the region’s growth strategy.
* Cross-Functional Orchestration: Act as a connector across functions, aligning internal stakeholders to deliver best-in-class customer experiences.
* Action Tracking & Follow-Up: Capture key takeaways, assign and track action items, and ensure timely follow-up and resolution.
* Executive Sponsorship & Deal Championing: Ensure strong executive sponsorship and advocacy for strategic accounts, supporting deal progression and governance.
* Meeting Optimization: Collaborate with sales teams to enhance C-suite meeting effectiveness—ensuring timely briefing materials, clear follow-ups, and accountability for commitments.
* Leadership Representation: Represent or deputize for the GVP in executive meetings as needed.
* Deal Coaching & QBR Participation: Contribute to big deal reviews and quarterly business reviews (QBRs), providing insights and coaching aligned with customer agendas.
* Presentation Development: Prepare executive briefs and presentation materials for the GVP and yourself, tailored to each customer engagement.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with big deal leaders and country managers to align on strategic priorities and customer engagement plans.


**Qualifications**
**Key Deliverables:**
* Volume and quality of C-suite engagements.
* Impactful meeting outcomes and contribution to deal acceleration.
* Strengthened strategic relationships and customer satisfaction.


****Qualifications:****
* 15–20 years of experience in sales or customer-facing leadership roles, with a strong track record of driving strategic deals.
* Exceptional organizational and prioritization skills, with the ability to manage short- and mid-term objectives.
* Meticulous attention to detail and a passion for excellence.
* Strong leadership and influencing capabilities across diverse stakeholder groups.
* Proven ability to foster collaboration, resolve conflicts, and drive cross-functional alignment.
* Customer-centric mindset with a problem-solving orientation.
* Strategic thinker with sharp business judgment and the ability to see the big picture.
* Executive presence with outstanding verbal and written communication skills (native or professional-level English).
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and change in a fast-paced environment.
* High energy, strong work ethic, and disciplined execution.
* Passionate about process improvement and operational efficiency.
* Travel up to 30% of the time


 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2025 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: Fullstack Data & AI Developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Join our Data Team as a Full Stack Applications/AI Developer, where you'll be at the forefront of transforming business processes through innovative Data & AI solutions. In this role, you'll develop comprehensive data heavy and AI applications that enhance operational efficiency across our organization. You'll work together with our Data Engineers & Analysts to create seamless, integrated systems that drive productivity and innovation. Experience in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is a plus but not required.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Data/AI Application Development:
+ Design, develop, test, and deploy full stack data heavy and AI applications that streamline business processes.
+ Integrate AI models with both front-end and back-end systems to ensure robust and user-friendly applications.

* Collaboration & Integration:
+ Work closely with the Data & Insights Team to translate business process into effective data and AI-driven solutions.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of applications with existing systems.

* Innovation & Continuous Improvement:
+ Research and implement cutting-edge AI technologies and frameworks to drive continuous improvement.
+ Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in AI and full stack development.

* Optional Chatbot Development:


 Utilize experience (if applicable) in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots to enhance customer interaction channels.
   

  

**What We Want From You**
 For us, it is equally important to find the right fit on an interpersonal level between us and a new colleague as it is to find someone with the right experience and competence. Successful candidates also meet the following requirements
   

  

* Technical Expertise:
* Proven experience as a Fullstack Developer with a focus on AI and machine learning applications.
* Strong proficiency in Frontend and Backend technologies (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc.).
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization tools is highly desirable.
* Experience with AI & ML frameworks (LangGraph, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, etc.) and RESTful API design.
* Collaborative Skills:
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.
* Strong communication skills to clearly articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Preferred Qualifications:
* Experience in developing enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is an added advantage.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: IT Operationschef Riksbyggen
description:
**Om rollen**
 Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren person som ska ta helhetsansvar för vår IT Operations. I tjänsten ingår att säkerställa att våra IT-miljö och tjänster fungerar smidigt samt bidrar till att Riksbyggens IT policy och övriga säkerhetsföreskrifter efterlevs. Som Operationschef kommer du även ansvara för att information och instruktioner proaktivt uppdateras och kommuniceras ut till slutanvändarna.
   

  

 Riksbyggen letar efter en person som jobbar för ständiga förbättringar. I denna tjänst får du möjligheten att påverka och ingå i ett bolag som ligger i framkant inom fastighetsbranschen när det kommer till digitalisering där IT support är en viktig del i detta. Riksbyggen arbetar för att öka den digitala mognaden på arbetsplatsen där IT support är en viktig del i att hjälpa slutanvändaren genom att informera och utbilda, samt ge hjälp till självhjälp. Rollen rapporterar till Riksbyggens CIO&CDO och är en del av Riksbyggens IT ledning.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden och huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
 I rollen som IT Operationschef på Riksbyggen ansvarar du för att leda ditt team och det operativa arbetet av drift och infrastruktur. IT miljön är en hybrid av både on-prem system och i Microsoft Azure cloud.
   

  

 Tillsammans med ditt team (10 specialister) säkerställer du att verksamheten får en högkvalitativ service och säker tillgång till infrastruktur och verksamhetssystem. Du driver aktivt det dagliga arbetet framåt med fokus på leverans och uppföljning av prioriterade förvaltningsaktiviteter mot beslutad verksamhetsplan, budget och målarkitektur. En del av ditt uppdrag är också att stödja och driva förändringsarbete inom IT och att Riksbyggen förflyttar sig i enlighet med den strategiska planen.
   

  

 Du är övergripande tjänsteansvarig för Riksbyggens klientplattformar, skrivare, konferensutrustning och tillbehör samt mjukvara. Du har kontinuerlig uppföljning med avtalade leverantörer och partners. Utöver detta så innefattas även första och andra linjen support där du ansvarar för att underleverantör och vår egen andra linje fungerar enligt önskad kundnytta och SLA.
   

  

 Viktiga framtidsfrågor är att vi håller på med en förflyttning till molnet samt att IT säkerhet får alltmer fokus i vårt arbete.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som ledare är du engagerad och förtroendeingivande, du har en god teknisk kompetens och värdesätter samarbete högt. Du är pedagogisk, kommunikativ, strukturerad, drivande och tar tillsammans med ditt team tag i de uppgifter som behöver lösas med ett positivt och fokuserat engagemang.
   

  

**Vi ser att du har:**
* Erfarenhet i liknande chefsposition
* Van att jobba med operativ och taktisk uppföljning av IT leverantörer
* Förmågan att koordinera flera aktiviteter och projekt samtidigt
* Erfarenhet av teknisk support och lösa IT-problem
* Relevant utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Kunskap om både drift av on-prem och Microsoft Azure cloud
* Erfarenhet av teknisk IT säkerhet
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska
* Erfarenhet av ledningsgruppsarbete (meriterande)


**Placering**
 Du kommer att ha placering på Riksbyggens huvudkontor på Kungsbron i centrala Stockholm. Flexibelt startdatum, med hänsyn till din uppsägningstid. Tjänsten är på tillsvidare, Riksbyggen tillämpar provanställning.
   

  

**Har du några frågor eller funderingar?**
 Hör gärna av dig om du har några frågor. Kontakta Per Karmteg (CIO&CDO) via e-post per.karmteg@riksbyggen.se
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Din ansökan skickar du till oss via Riksbyggen.se – Lediga jobb. Sista ansökningsdag är
   

  

 19 oktober 2025. Vi gör löpande urval så sök redan idag! Vi ser fram emot din ansökan.
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Som anställd på Riksbyggen förväntas du också vara ledamot i någon/några bostadsrättsföreningar, i de fall du har ledamotsuppdrag så utgår ett ansvarsarvode. Klicka HÄR om du är nyfiken på Riksbyggen. Till rekryteringskonsulter, annonssäljare etc. Vi har redan beslutat vilka vi samarbetar med vid rekryteringar samt var vi vill synas. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt från försäljare i dessa frågor.

title: SAP Basis Architect
company_industry: Information Technology & Services, Software Development, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
Company: US3 Consulting
 



 About Company: US3 Consulting is a leading European IT recruitment agency dedicated to connecting top tech talent with innovative companies across the continent. With decades of experience and a fresh approach, we specialize in rapid, cost-effective candidate sourcing across all tech industry sectors. Our expert consultants are committed to building strong, productive relationships, ensuring the perfect fit between candidates and employers.
 



  





 Job Title: SAP Basis Architect
 



 Total Experience Required: 15+ years in Information Technology/Computers/Software
 



 Relevant Experience Required: 10+ years in SAP Basis administration, architecture, and implementation
 



 Job Type: Contract
 



 Contract Duration: A minimum duration of 12 months, with the possibility of extension up to 18 months or beyond, depending on project requirements.
 



 Workplace Type: Hybrid (at least 3 times a week at office)
 



 Languages Required: English, Swedish is a plus
 



 Visa/Work Authorization Status: Candidates must hold a valid work permit or visa to work in Sweden
 



 Work Location: Stockholm, Sweden
 


1. Must be currently based in Sweden or
2. Willing to relocate to Sweden from anywhere within Europe or the UK
3. Candidates outside Europe/UK unfortunately cannot be considered



  





 About Client: Client offers a dynamic environment where innovation and professional growth are at the forefront. With a strong emphasis on continuous learning, the company provides employees access to extensive training programs, including LinkedIn Learning and an Education Assistance Program.
 



  





 The company champions a balanced work-life culture, promoting flexible work hours and a supportive atmosphere that values diversity and inclusion. As a part of the esteemed group, it combines global opportunities with a commitment to employee well-being, making it an ideal workplace for those seeking both professional excellence and personal fulfillment.
 



  





 We are looking for a Senior SAP Basis Architect to lead and manage SAP Basis infrastructure, ensure system performance, and mentor junior team members. This is a contract role based in Stockholm, Sweden, with opportunities to work on complex SAP projects and architecture decisions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, implement, and manage SAP Basis architecture and infrastructure
* Perform system installations, upgrades, and migrations, including S4 HANA projects
* Monitor and optimize system performance for high availability and reliability
* Troubleshoot and resolve critical SAP Basis issues
* Collaborate with functional and technical teams on SAP projects and initiatives
* Develop and maintain SAP Basis process and procedure documentation
* Lead, mentor, and guide junior SAP Basis administrators
* Ensure compliance with IT security policies and procedures
* Represent in Solution Design authority board for architecture solution review and GAP analysis



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Extensive SAP Basis experience, including NetWeaver, HANA, and other SAP technologies
* Hands-on experience with SAP system installations, upgrades, and migrations
* Proficiency in performance tuning and system optimization
* Strong problem-solving, analytical, and leadership skills
* Experience with Azure cloud platforms and configuration
* Knowledge of SAP Solution Manager and Focused Run
* Familiarity with ITIL processes and best practices
* Database administration experience (Oracle, SQL Server)



  





**Optional Skills:** 



* Experience in large-scale enterprise SAP implementations
* SAP certification(s) preferred
* Exposure to cross-functional SAP architecture decisions
* Experience with hybrid cloud or multi-region SAP deployments



  





 Interested? Apply Now!
 



 📧 Send your resume to: sowmya@us3consulting.nl
 







 🔁 Not a fit for you? Share this with someone in your network who might be interested!
 



 🔗 Connect: linkedin.com/in/sowmyakotamarthy
 



 🌐 Visit our homepage: https://www.us3consulting.co.uk
 



 🔗 Follow us on LinkedIn for more exciting opportunities: https://www.linkedin.com/company/us3-consulting
 



  





 #SAPBasis #S4HANA #SAPNetWeaver #AzureCloud #SAPArchitecture #ITIL #DatabaseAdministration #ContractRole #StockholmJobs #SAPSolutions

title: Regional Sales Manager - Nordics
description:
**Description**
 Silverfort is a cyber-security startup that develops a revolutionary identity protection platform. Our mission is to provide industry-leading unified identity protection solutions for hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Using patented technology, Silverfort’s platform enables strong authentication across entire corporate networks and cloud environments, without any modifications to endpoints and servers.
   

  

 Silverfort has been widely recognized as an industry innovator, being named “Best of MFA award” from Expert Insights, Microsoft Security 20/20 partner award, Homeland Security Award for Best Identity Access Management platform for its agentless secure authentication and zero trust platform by Astors.
   

  

 We are looking for a hungry, hunter-at-heart, Regional Sales Manager superstar to join our rapidly growing company and help boost our client-base across the Nordics Region.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Execute on the entire sales cycle end-to-end: create and qualify leads and pipeline, manage high-quality C-level customer meetings, oversee POCs, perform key account management, negotiate and close
* Establish and maintain direct relationships with C-level executives in target end-customer accounts as well as in key channel partners
* Develop and execute comprehensive business plans for strategic accounts, become a trusted advisor for prospects, evangelize value propositions on an expert-level
* Capture, reflect and maintain sales forecast diligently in SFDC
* Collaborate with presale, product, marketing and customer success teams to maximize overall customer satisfaction
* Meet/exceed sales quota


**Requirements**
* 6+ years of B2B sales experience overall, out of which 3+ years in direct sales of cybersecurity or IAM software solutions to medium and large enterprises
* Proven track record of consistently meeting/overachieving sales quotas
* Experience in working closely and collaboratively with channel partners
* Pro-active, hungry, self-driven individual, with a whatever-it-takes attitude
* Passionate about innovative technology and about winning customers’ hearts and minds
* Outstanding communication skills, comfortable presenting to C-level executives and technical leads alike
* Experience in selling technical products of startup-stage vendors- a significant advantage

title: Data Engineer for Cary Group
description:
Are you a good Data Engineer with solid experience building data platforms the best way?
   

  

 Cary Group comes from a long tradition of entrepreneurial family businesses with a culture that cultivates entrepreneurship and is recognized for its sense of togetherness.
   

  

 We are looking for a Data Engineer to join Cary Group in Stockholm!
   

  

**About The Job**
 In the role of Data Engineer at Cary Group, you will be involved in the continuous improvement of Cary Group's cloud data platform. You will be a central part of the Group’s work in the data management area, further harmonizing procedures, routines and semantics. In this role, you will be part of Cary Group’s central Data Management team.
   

  

 Your primary work assignments:
   

  

* Design, build and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines and data models.
* Ensure data quality, integrity and governance across group’s data and integration platform.
* Collaborate with important business stakeholders to find new opportunities and drive usage in various parts of the organization.
* Contribute to designing Cary Group’s common data architecture.
* Drive continuous improvement of Cary Group’s data engineering capabilities, best practices and internal processes.
* Stay updated on technological trends to ensure the platform remains safe, reliable, and performant.


**THE ROLE**
**We believe you have:**
* Experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Azure and Data Factory
* Experience building pipelines and data models
* Proficiency in C#/Python/SQL for data manipulation and automation.
* Experience with SQL/NoSQL and Data Lake solutions
* Knowledge of DevOps, Git, and CI/CD
* Experience working closely with business stakeholders to translate needs into technical solutions
* Post-secondary education in computer/data science
* Experience with BI tools such as Power BI
* Speaks and writes English fluently


 You are analytical, unpretentious, and enjoy creating structure in complex environments. With a business-driven mindset, you see opportunities and take initiative to develop both solutions and ways of working.
   

  

**About Us**
 Welcome to Cary Group – a fast-growing international group embarked on an exciting journey. We are one of the market leaders in Sweden, Denmark, Norway, UK, Spain, Portugal, France, Germany, Austria, Luxembourg and Belgium in repair and replacement of vehicle glass, with a complementary offering in auto body repair. Our services sustain the life, value and safety features of motorised vehicles. Cary Group has grown rapidly during the last years, through both national and international acquisitions. With convenient locations, high-quality products and smart solutions, we help our customers make simplified and sustainable choices.
   

  

 We offer a family-oriented and entrepreneurial culture where everyone can make an impact. We care for each other and like to invest in activities and events to strengthen our team. Our modern offices are situated in Hammarby sjöstad in Stockholm.
   

  

 For more information, visit carygroup.com
   

  

**Contact:**
 For this recruitment, Cary Group is collaborating with Wise IT. If you’d like to know more, contact recruitment consultant Sandra Åhs at sandra.ahs@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Unfortunately, we cannot accept applications via email as we value your personal privacy. You can read more about how we handle personal data according to GDPR in the Wise Group’s privacy policy.
   

  

 We process applications on an ongoing basis, and the selection of candidates for interviews is continuous.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Data Engineer/Data Analytics consultant
description:
Om rollen
   

  

 Vi är en relativt ny enhet som söker fler kollegor som vill vara med på en spännande resa framåt med innovation och tillväxt i fokus. Våra kunder behöver stöd i sina möjligheter att bli än mer effektiva och det genom digitalisering och effektivisering.
   

  

 Med hjälp av Data Analytics-lösningar kan de dels få rätt underlag för sina beslut men också se potentiella möjligheter och utfall. Steget vidare är att få det automatiserat, dynamiskt vilket vi ser till att lösa. Enkelhet är något vi förespråkar och vårt mål är alltid att hjälpa våra kunder att få en enklare vardag. Visst låter det kul?
   

  

 Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

 Vi söker medarbetare som är drivna, affärsmässiga, lösningsorienterade och pragmatiska. Du som har kunskap inom något av våra erbjudanden samt trivs i entreprenöriella arbetsmiljöer där nya idéer och initiativtagande uppmuntras. Vi ser gärna att du kommer från ett etablerat konsultbolag med minst 4 års erfarenhet.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet inom något/ några av följande områden, plattformar och verktyg:**
* Data Arkitekt
* Data Engineer
* Data Analyst
* Business Analyst
* Projektledning inom BI & analytics
* Datamodellering
* SQL programmering
* Andra språk som Python & Java är ett plus
* Erfarenhet av både analys och rapportverktyg så som Power BI, Tableau eller Business Objects
* Erfarenhet av olika integrationsverktyg/ETL-verktyg samt olika databaser exempelvis SSIS, Databricks, Synapse, DBT eller Matillion
* Gärna arbetat med molnlösningar så som Azure & Snowflake
* Gärna erfarenhet av Machine Learning, AI, Data Lakes


**Vad vi erbjuder?**
 Vi tror på ett arbetsklimat där kunskap delas, initiativ uppmuntras och varje medarbetare får utvecklas – både professionellt och personligt. Med höga ambitioner och högt i tak skapar vi en miljö där det är lätt att trivas. För oss är det viktigt med work-life-balance, och vi värnar om en trygg arbetsmiljö där du mår bra och känner dig sedd.
   

  

**Marknadsmässiga villkor och förmåner som stödjer dig**
 Utöver konkurrenskraftig lön erbjuder vi en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell, trygga pensions- och försäkringslösningar samt friskvårdsbidrag. Dessutom bjuder vi in på sociala aktiviteter som after work, kickoff och konferensresor
   

  

 Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige och omsätter 500 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

title: Storage Sales Specialist
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
**HPE Data Services and Storage is looking for an experienced Storage Sales Specialist**
 HPE is offering an exciting opportunity in a market that is moving faster than ever before. Digital transformation has become an imperative for every customer – and successful digital transformation requires data-first modernization. This demands a shift to a data-centric mindset – understanding that data is the key driver of value creation, and a key organizing principle for business success.
   

  

 HPE is a proud leader in the storage market and known as the most innovative vendor in the marketplace. Our culture is characterized by a no-nonsense culture with high drive and optimistic people; entrepreneurs who embrace the constant transformation that our industry is facing and looking for new market opportunities to keep and expand our leading market position.
   

  

**Summary Of The Role**
 Responsible for leading pursuits in Data Services and Storage. Collaborates with and supports Account Managers and provides specialist expertise within the sales team. Drives proactive sales and closing opportunities, using his/her specialized knowledge and skills to prospect, qualify, negotiate and close opportunities.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Responsible for sales of storage products and solutions in assigned accounts.
* Uses advanced storage expertise to seek out new opportunities for customer value by expanding and enhancing existing opportunities.
* Creates and drives the storage sales pipeline. Captures leads outside of specialization and uses closed-loop lead management to ensure assignment and follow-up by others.
* Collaborates with the account pursuit teams to leverage their solutions expertise for business development.
* Contributes to development of quota objectives and future direction for storage product lines.
* Directs and coordinates supporting sales activities related to pipeline hygiene through account managers, Presales, channel partners and other relevant stakeholders.
* Effectively uses internal sales tools to maintain a healthy pipeline and the account plan in a timely fashion.
* Collaborates across the HPE teams to deliver a consistent approach to developing business, including account planning for end-to-end solutions.
* Negotiates and drives profitable deals to ensure successful closure and a high win rate.
* Establishes a professional and consultative relationship with the client by achieving an advanced understanding of the unique business needs of the client within the industry. Works with clients up to and including the C-level for mid-to-large accounts.
* Acts as a trusted storage solutions consultant for the slated accounts
* Reinforces and articulates HPE's strategy and portfolio to partners and champions to uncover new business opportunities and contacts, including new logos when appropriate.
* Effectively uses references to craft a story that makes complex technologies seem simple and understandable for the customers
* Actively generates customer interest and anticipates customer's buying trends. Links business and financial benefits with technology offerings. Illustrates the ROI & TCO advantages of HPE offerings for the customer's business.
* Cultivates and maintains positive relationships with customers to ensure account retention and growth, to position the company as the preferred vendor to meet business needs.


**Knowledge And Skills Required**
* Understanding Data Services and Storage and software, Greenlake as a Services and financial offerings.
* Understand the competition and differentiate presenting HPE’s unique values.
* Understands the industry and market segment in which key accounts are situated and integrates this knowledge into consultative selling.
* Business planning skills, multi-dimensional.
* Experienced with working with channel partners and/or end-users.
* Strong communication skills.


**Education And Experience Required**
* University or bachelor’s degree preferred.
* Demonstrated achievement of progressively higher quota, interface with diverse business customers at all levels.
* Fluency in Swedish and English languages is required.
* Typically, 5-10+ years of sales experience.
* Storage related sales experience strongly desired.
* Extensive vertical industry knowledge required.


**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Unconditional Inclusion**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #sweden
   

  

 #sales, #storage
   

  

**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**Job Level**
 Expert
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Systemutvecklare/DevOps till Stockholm
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Custom Software Development, and Computer and Network Security
description:
**Vill du vara med och bidra till ett säkrare samhälle?** 




  





 Basalt är ett av branschens ledande säkerhetsföretag med expertis inom IT-säkerhet, informationssäkerhet, krisberedskap och totalförsvar samt systematiskt säkerhetsskyddsarbete. Vi har även marknadens säkraste IT-plattform/PaaS – Craton – för organisationer med de högsta skyddskraven.
 



  





 Just nu befinner vi oss i en stark tillväxtfas och behöver därför förstärka vårt team i Stockholm med dig som vill arbeta med att utveckla nästa generation av Craton och arbeta som stemutvecklare inom säkra system.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




  





 Hos oss kommer du att ingå i ett team som arbetar med att utveckla och leverera Craton till våra kunder. Vi levererar totallösningar för organisationer som inte kan använda vanliga IT-system på grund av högt ställda skyddskrav.
 



  





 Du kommer att arbeta i komplexa IT-miljöer. Vi arbetar agilt och hos oss får du möjligheten att utvecklas i nära samarbete med kunniga kollegor som brinner för att ta Craton till nästa nivå. Craton är byggd som en private cloud-lösning för hela systemmiljöer och är mer metod än teknikval. Vi arbetar med integration av system, orkestrering, helautomatiserade miljöer samt microservices. Läs mer om Basalts IT-plattform Craton här.
 



  





 Vi är i en tillväxtfas och du har därför möjlighet att påverka ditt ansvar utifrån dina intressen och din bakgrund. Hos oss får du bygga upp en stark kompetens inom säkerhetsskydd tillsammans med erfarna experter, vilket ger dig en unik kunskap inom ett samhällsviktigt område med växande betydelse.
 



  





**Din bakgrund** 




  





 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:
 


* DevOps/utveckling i automatiserade IT-miljöer
* Intresse för att bygga lösningar i Ansible
* Goda kunskaper i Linux
* Erfarenhet av programmering i ett modernt språk
* Förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift



  





 Som person är du kommunikativ och trivs med att diskutera tekniska lösningar. Du har ett intresse för IT-säkerhet och en vilja att lära dig ny teknik. Du har förmågan att uttrycka dig väl på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift, då dokumentation är en del av vårt arbete.
 



  





 För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du har ett intresse för infrastruktur, systemintegrationer samt nätverk och kommunikation, eftersom Craton erbjuder helhetslösningar. Hos oss kommer du att få möjlighet att lära dig de specifika verktygen och systemen du behöver för att lyckas i din roll.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




  





 För att ge dig trygghet och stabilitet erbjuder vi ett förmånspaket som inkluderar en av marknadens bästa pensionslösningar, omfattande försäkringar, förstärkt föräldralön och ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr per år. Du får tillgång till Benifix, en förmånsportal med rabatter och vi erbjuder kontinuerliga möjligheter till kompetensutveckling för att du ska kunna växa i din roll.
 



  





 Vi värnar om balansen mellan arbete och fritid. Hos oss har du flexibla arbetstider, 5-timmars arbetsdag innan helgdagar och ledigt på klämdagar så att du får tid för både jobb och privatliv. På Basalt gör vi också många uppskattade gemensamma aktiviteter, som skidresor, träningspass, sociala luncher samt frukostar och after works på kontoret. Vi tycker om att umgås, utbyta idéer och ha kul tillsammans.
 



  





 Vårt kontor ligger centralt i Stockholm, nära våra kollegor på Omegapoint, vilket gör det enkelt att samarbeta och träffas.
 



  





 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och om hur det är att arbeta på Basalt här!
 



  





**Din ansökan** 




  





 Ansök med ditt CV och beskriv kort vad du söker i din nästa roll. Vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer, så ansök gärna redan idag!
 



  





 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. Våra anställda är placerade i säkerhetsklass i enlighet med de krav som finns i säkerhetsskyddslagen, då våra kunders verksamhet kräver detta. Detta medför att svenskt medborgarskap är ett villkor för tjänsten.
 



  





**Mer om oss** 




  





 Basalt är experter inom verksamhets- och säkerhetsskydd, med djup kunskap inom systematiskt säkerhetsarbete och utveckling av säkra IT-lösningar. Vi stödjer företag, myndigheter och kommuner i att skydda sin mest värdefulla information från både interna och externa hot. Basalt grundades 2009 och vi är ca 120 medarbetare. Basalt blev en del av Omegapoint Group 2022.
 



  





 Vår vision är att Basalt ska vara det självklara valet för att skapa ett säkert och robust samhälle. Våra värderingar bygger på att vara både vassa och snälla – vi kombinerar hög prestation och expertis med en kultur där vi bryr oss om varandra och skapar en positiv, stöttande miljö.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Penetration Tester
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Senior Penetration Tester to team up with the most dedicated team of cybersecurity specialists in our Offensive Security team.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Senior Penetration Tester who wants to make a difference in our Offensive Security Team.
   

  

**Offensive Security**
 Truesec’s Offensive Security Team is a group of dedicated cybersecurity specialists working proactively to help organizations protect themselves against cyber breaches by identifying vulnerabilities before they are exploited. As part of this team, you’ll collaborate closely with some of the world’s top security experts, leveraging combined knowledge and experience to conduct penetration tests, security assessments, and advanced red and purple team engagements.
   

  

 The work is highly technical and focuses on uncovering security weaknesses in enterprise- and cloud environments, including mobile applications, cloud platforms, IOT/OT systems, and both Linux and Microsoft infrastructures. Team members lead assignments from start to finish, maintaining direct contact with customers and driving projects alongside colleagues, all with the shared mission of making a real difference in cybersecurity and contributing to a safer digital world
   

  

**The Role**
 In this role, you will be part of the Offensive Security Team at Truesec, granting you the opportunity to work with some of the best security specialists in the world. As a Senior Penetration tester you will primarily conduct advanced security reviews and penetration tests as well as lead and drive the projects with a colleague. You will be leading the assignments from start to finish, meaning that you will be in close contact with our customers for initiation meetings and lead the entire testing-process, as well as leading other colleagues in your team within the projects.
   

  

 The assignments are performed on a technical level where you will actively look for security vulnerabilities, mostly in enterprise environments. Typical projects can be penetration testing of mobile applications, Linux and Microsoft environments, AWS, Google, and IOT/OT or advanced red and purple teaming assignments.
   

  

 To succeed in this role we believe that you are a true expert in a specific area or technology and repeatedly mastermind other implementations with the ambition to make a difference.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 We all have various backgrounds, but what we have in common is our love and joy of IT security and hacking. If you share our passion, join us!
   

  

**Required Skills:**
 You should meet most of the following requirements, or be a true expert in a few.
   

  

* Experience in penetration testing of enterprise environments.
* Ability to identify vulnerabilities in both Windows and Linux systems.
* Experience in network-based penetration tests.
* Experience in credentials extraction and lateral movement.
* Ability to identify vulnerabilities on mobile applications.
* Experience in penetration testing of IOT/OT systems.
* Ability to identify vulnerabilities in cloud environments.
* Ability to present findings to a non-technical audience.


**Bonus Skills:**
* Sysadmin experience.
* Ability to understand arbitrary programming language.
* Full proficiency in at least one programming language.
* Experience of code assisted/code review-based penetration testing.
* Relevant security related certifications.


 As a senior penetration tester, we believe that you actively stay up to date with the latest technologies or maybe you are active in several forums or networks within offensive security. At Truesec we believe in creating awareness and we continuously attend events as guests or even key note speakers.
   

  

*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Systemansvarig med passion för flygplats och IT
description:
**Vill du vara en del av Swedavias digitaliseringsresa och arbeta med affärskritiska IT-lösningar på våra flygplatser?**
 Vi söker en driven och engagerad Service Delivery Manager (SDM) till vårt team, som vill utvecklas hos oss. I denna roll får du en betydelsefull och utvecklande möjlighet att arbeta med systemförvaltning och systemutveckling som direkt påverkar flygplatsverksamheten. Tillsammans med ditt team bidrar du till att skapa effektiva och stabila lösningar för både interna och externa användare.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Du ansvarar för förvaltningen och vidareutvecklingen av flera IT-lösningar inom parkering och angöring och våra digitala kanaler. Du arbetar självständigt i ett mindre team tillsammans med förvaltningsledarna. Vi jobbar efter en variant av förvaltningsstyrningsmodellen PM3.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Säkerställa att leveranser uppfyller avtalade servicenivåer (SLA).
* Planera och följa upp ekonomi för IT-lösningarna.
* Kravställa mot leverantörer och implementera nya tjänster och system.
* Arbeta kontinuerligt med att förbättra processer och skapa stabilitet i leveranser.
* Säkerställa att IT-lösningarna uppfyller våra IT policys och regelverk.
* Delta i projekt inom sitt ansvarsområde.


 Du arbetar nära både interna och externa parter för att utveckla och optimera IT-system som stödjer den dagliga verksamheten på flygplatserna. Rollen innebär ett stort ansvar och ett nära samarbete med våra leverantörer och interna avdelningar för att säkerställa att våra lösningar är både effektiva och hållbara över tid.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara social, nyfiken och tekniskt intresserad, samtidigt som du är noggrann, flexibel och har god prioriteringsförmåga.
   

  

 Vidare har du:
   

  

* Högskoleutbildning inom IT.
* Erfarenhet av att förvalta och vidareutveckla IT-lösningar.
* Trivs i en roll med många kontaktytor.
* Erfarenhet av systemförvaltning och IT-stöd för verksamheter.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Erfarenhet av ITIL och leveransstyrning.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med systemförvaltning och IT-lösningar för flygplatsverksamheten i ett spännande och utvecklande område. I en dynamisk och samarbetsinriktad arbetsmiljö hjälper du och ditt team varandra att driva utveckling och förbättring. Du får möjlighet att påverka och utveckla de lösningar som används dagligen på våra flygplatser, vilket ger dig en unik chans att påverka både verksamheten och den tekniska plattformen.
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Mia Bystedt, mia.bystedt@swedavia.se
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag är den 17 oktober, urval sker löpande och annonsen kan stängas tidigare så tveka inte att söka redan idag!**
**Hur är det att arbeta på Swedavia?**
 Vårt fokus är att möjliggöra hållbart resande och uppmuntra nytänkande för att skapa en välkomnande, trygg och inkluderande arbetsgemenskap där du kan växa och göra verklig skillnad – läs mer här! Jobba hos oss | Om Swedavia
   

  

 För en objektiv och rättvis rekrytering använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester som en del av urvalsprocessen.
   

  

 Då flygplatser är en säkerhetsklassad verksamhet genomgår samtliga kandidater som går vidare i rekryteringsprocessen en bakgrundskontroll. För vissa tjänster även en säkerhetsprövning. Swedavia är även en drogfri arbetsplats med nolltolerans mot droger. Drogtester genomförs före anställning och sker slumpmässigt under anställningen.

title: Senior Web Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for senior developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is relatively broad and focused on web technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern web stack technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Web Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Use modern frontend frameworks such as NextJS, Svelte, or Flutter to create amazing digital experiences.
* Engaging with backend languages and frameworks like Go, Rust, or Kotlin to craft scalable integration middle layers.
* Working with contemporary SaaS headless CMS and E-commerce platforms including Centra, Shopify, and MedusaJS.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organizations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.
* You have worked professionally as a Web Developer for at least 5 years.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: AI Software Engineer/Platform Architect - BCG X
description:
**Locations** 
 : Stockholm | Copenhagen V | Berlin | München | London
   

  

 Who We Are
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
   

  

 To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
   

  

**We Are BCG X**
 We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.
   

  

 As a (Senior) AI Software Engineer you’ll be part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.
   

  

 We Are Looking For Talented Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Transforming Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
   

  

* +4 years of experience in a technology consulting environment
* Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
* Actively involved in every part of the software development life cycle
* Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
* Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
* Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
* Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
* A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics
* Master's degree or PhD in relevant field of study - please provide all academic certificates showing the final grades (A-level, Bachelor, Master, PhD)


**Additional Tasks**
* Designing and building data & AI platforms for our clients.
* Such platforms provide data and (Gen)AI capabilities to a wide variety of consumers and use cases across the client organization.
* Often part of large (AI) transformational journeys BCG does for its clients.
* Often involves the following engineering disciplines:
+ Cloud Engineering
+ Data Engineering (not building pipelines but designing and building the framework)
+ DevOps
+ MLOps/LLMOps
+ ...

* Often work with the following technologies:
+ Azure, AWS, GCP
+ Airflow, dbt, Databricks, Snowflake, etc.
+ GitHub, Azure DevOps and related developer tooling and CI/CD platforms, Terraform or other Infra-as-Code
+ MLflow, AzureML or similar for MLOps; LangSmith, Langfuse and similar for LLMOps
+ ...


*The difference to our "AI Engineer" role is: Do you "use/consume" these technologies, or are you the one that "provides" them to the rest of the organization.*
 What You'll Bring
   

  

**Technologies**
 Programming Languages: Python
   

  

**Experience With Additional Programming Languages Is a Plus**
 Additional info
   

  

 BCG offers a comprehensive benefits program, including medical, dental and vision coverage, telemedicine services, life, accident and disability insurance, parental leave and family planning benefits, caregiving resources, mental health offerings, a generous retirement program, financial guidance, paid time off, and more.
   

  

 #BCGXjob
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
